original: de nyid gar gyi bstan bcos kyis thob pa yin na /
analyzed: de nyid gar gyi bstan bcos kyis thob pa yin na /
translated: If it is obtained by the treatise of dance,

original: de shes sam zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: de shes sam zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: then ask, “Do you know that?”

original: lan du nga @52b yis shes te dbang po gnyis sprad pa'i bde ba las rtogs zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gang zhig so ni ston pa la //
analyzed: lan du nga @52b yis shes te dbang po gnyis sprad pa'i bde ba las rtogs zhes bya ba'i don to // gang zhig so ni ston pa la //
translated: The answer is, “I know it, because I understand it from the bliss of uniting the two organs.”🔽To one who shows the teeth,

original: de yi kha ni rab tu bstan //
analyzed: de yi kha ni rab tu bstan //
translated: show the mouth.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin shes sam zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin shes sam zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: This means, “Do you know the nature of wisdom?”

original: lan du nga yis shes te thabs dang shes rab ldan na'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lan du nga yis shes te thabs dang shes rab ldan na'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The answer is, “I know it, because I have method and wisdom.”

original: gang zhig khro gnyer ston pa la //
analyzed: gang zhig khro gnyer ston pa la //
translated: To one who shows a frown,

original: gtsug phud dgrol ba bstan par bya //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gtsug phud dgrol ba bstan par bya // zhes pa ni /
translated: show the untied topknot.

original: 'on khyod dang nga gnyis thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin la brtsad do zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: 'on khyod dang nga gnyis thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin la brtsad do zhes zer ba la /
translated: This means, “Well then, you and I will debate about the nature of method and wisdom.”

original: lan du / 'jigs pa med de brtsad par bya'o //
analyzed: lan du / 'jigs pa med de brtsad par bya'o //
translated: The answer is, “There is no fear; let us debate.”

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gang zhig dpral ba ston pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to // gang zhig dpral ba ston pa la /
translated: This is the meaning.🔽To one who shows the forehead,

original: de yi rgyab ni rab tu bstan //
analyzed: de yi rgyab ni rab tu bstan //
translated: show the back.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means,

original: gang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi gnas lus kyi mchog mgo la yod na de khyod kyis shes sam zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: gang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi gnas lus kyi mchog mgo la yod na de khyod kyis shes sam zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: If the supreme place and body of the dakinis is on the head, do you know that?

original: lan du nga yis shes te mgo bo las gzhan rgyab la sogs pa lus gzhan yang mkha' 'gro ma'i gnas yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lan du nga yis shes te mgo bo las gzhan rgyab la sogs pa lus gzhan yang mkha' 'gro ma'i gnas yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reply is: I know that the other places of the dakinis are on the body, other than the head, such as the back.

original: gang zhig rkang mthil ston pa la //
analyzed: gang zhig rkang mthil ston pa la //
translated: To him who shows the soles of his feet,

original: lto yis rnam par rtse bar bya //
analyzed: lto yis rnam par rtse bar bya //
translated: one should play with the stomach.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This means:

original: 'o na gnas de dag tu ji ltar 'grong par bya /🔽zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: 'o na gnas de dag tu ji ltar 'grong par bya / zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: How does one go to those places?

original: lan du gar gyi bstan bcos sngon du 'gro bas chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis snyoms par zhugs nas gnas de rnams su phyin par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lan du gar gyi bstan bcos sngon du 'gro bas chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis snyoms par zhugs nas gnas de rnams su phyin par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The reply is: Having entered into union with a passionate mind, preceded by the treatise of dance, one will go to those places.

original: phyag rgya phyag rgya'i lan gyis ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya phyag rgya'i lan gyis ni //
translated: By the seal and the reply of the seal,

original: dam tshig gis ni rnam par dbye //
analyzed: dam tshig gis ni rnam par dbye //
translated: one should separate by means of the pledge.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This means:

original: lus kyi phyag rgya'i brda shes pas //
analyzed: lus kyi phyag rgya'i brda shes pas //
translated: By knowing the symbolic language of the seal of the body,

original: gsang chen thams cad rtogs par bya //🔽zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsang chen thams cad rtogs par bya //🔽zhes pa'i don to //
translated: one should understand all the secrets.

original: de la rnal 'byor mas smras pa //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor mas smras pa //
translated: The yoginī said to him:

original: ae ma bu ni snying rje che //
analyzed: ae ma bu ni snying rje che //
translated: “Ema! Son, you are very compassionate!🔽”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means:

original: ae ma thabs chen po'i rang bzhin khyod kyis brda dang brda ma yin pa thams cad la goms par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ae ma thabs chen po'i rang bzhin khyod kyis brda dang brda ma yin pa thams cad la goms par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Ema! You who are the nature of great means have become familiar with all the signs and non-signs.”

original: gal te phreng ba lag ston na //
analyzed: gal te phreng ba lag ston na //
translated: If she shows her rosary in her hand,

original: 'du bar bya zhes smra ba yin //
analyzed: 'du bar bya zhes smra ba yin //
translated: she is saying, “Let’s meet.”

original: phreng ba mngon par btang byas nas //🔽dam tshig la mnos brtul zhugs bzang //
analyzed: phreng ba mngon par btang byas nas // dam tshig la mnos brtul zhugs bzang //
translated: If she throws the rosary,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: she is saying, “I have taken the pledge of discipline.”

original: de ltar brda'i lan la rnal 'byor ma thams cad rang sa nas lag na phreng ba ston par byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar brda'i lan la rnal 'byor ma thams cad rang sa nas lag na phreng ba ston par byed cing /
translated: Thus, in response to the signs, all yoginīs show their rosaries in their hands.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod dang nga gnyis bde ba'i phreng ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i brtul zhugs la gnas par bya'o zhes ston la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod dang nga gnyis bde ba'i phreng ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i brtul zhugs la gnas par bya'o zhes ston la /
translated: “Son of good family, you and I should both maintain the discipline of the uninterrupted rosary of bliss.”

original: gzhan yang 'di skad ces /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di skad ces /
translated: Moreover, she says this:

original: de la phyi rol zhes 'du ba //
analyzed: de la phyi rol zhes 'du ba //
translated: “Let’s meet outside.”

original: bzang po'i spyod yul gnas pa ni //
analyzed: bzang po'i spyod yul gnas pa ni //
translated: She is saying, “Let’s meet in a good place.”

original: de la 'du ba'i rnal 'byor mas //
analyzed: de la 'du ba'i rnal 'byor mas //
translated: The yoginī who is meeting there

original: gang smras de ltar thams cad bya //
analyzed: gang smras de ltar thams cad bya //
translated: Do everything as you have said.

original: zhes bya @53a * //
analyzed: zhes bya @53a * //
translated: This is the meaning:

original: ba ni ; khyod ni skal ba dang ldan te phyi dang nang gi dgongs pa'i skad thams cad kyang shes pa de bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: ba ni ; khyod ni skal ba dang ldan te phyi dang nang gi dgongs pa'i skad thams cad kyang shes pa de bas de'i phyir /
translated: You are fortunate, and you know all the outer and inner intended meanings of the words. Therefore,

original: khyod dang bdag cag phyi'i gnas su 'dus la phyi dang nang gi bde ba'i ston mo la longs spyad par bya'o zhes bsgo ba na /
analyzed: khyod dang bdag cag phyi'i gnas su 'dus la phyi dang nang gi bde ba'i ston mo la longs spyad par bya'o zhes bsgo ba na /
translated: you and we will gather in the outer place and enjoy the feast of outer and inner bliss.🔽When this is commanded, the yogin accepts everything.

original: rnal 'byor pa des kyang thams cad dang du blang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des kyang thams cad dang du blang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is, I will do everything.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das 'du ba'i gnas du lags zhes rdo rje snying po la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi gnas kyi khyad par zhus pa'o //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das 'du ba'i gnas du lags zhes rdo rje snying po la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi gnas kyi khyad par zhus pa'o //
translated: The question Where is the place of the gathering, O Bhagavān? is asked by Vajra Heart and so on, referring to the outer and inner places.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang ni //
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang ni //
translated: The places and the nearby places,

original: zhing dang nye ba'i zhing nyid dang / tsa ndo nye ba'i tsha ndo dang // 'du ba nye ba'i 'du ba dang // grong khyer nye ba'i grong khyer dang // dur khrod nye ba'i dur khrod de //
analyzed: zhing dang nye ba'i zhing nyid dang / tsa ndo nye ba'i tsha ndo dang // 'du ba nye ba'i 'du ba dang // grong khyer nye ba'i grong khyer dang // dur khrod nye ba'i dur khrod de //
translated: and the charnel ground and the neighboring charnel ground.

original: 'di rnams sa ni bcu gnyis phyir //
analyzed: 'di rnams sa ni bcu gnyis phyir //
translated: These are the twelve stages.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug mgon po nyid //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug mgon po nyid //
translated: The lord of the ten stages is the protector himself.

original: de phyir gzhan du btsal mi bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de phyir gzhan du btsal mi bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, do not search elsewhere.

original: 'dis ni 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid dang / 'khor lo drug gi bdag nyid dang // 'khor lo bzhi'i bdag nyid la gnas ba rtsa'i rigs thams cad sa bcu gnyis nyid du ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid dang / 'khor lo drug gi bdag nyid dang // 'khor lo bzhi'i bdag nyid la gnas ba rtsa'i rigs thams cad sa bcu gnyis nyid du ston te /
translated: This teaches that all the types of channels, which are the nature of the three wheels, the nature of the six wheels, and the nature of the four wheels, are the twelve stages.

original: de yang 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid ni sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi bye brag dang / sa 'og sa steng sa bla'i dbye bas bde mchog 'khor lo'i rgyud kyi don brjod do //
analyzed: de yang 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid ni sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi bye brag dang / sa 'og sa steng sa bla'i dbye bas bde mchog 'khor lo'i rgyud kyi don brjod do //
translated: The nature of the three wheels is the nature of the body, speech, and mind, and the division of the lower, upper, and middle stages.

original: 'khor lo drug gi bdag nyid ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo drug gi bdag nyid ni /
translated: The nature of the six wheels is the nature of the six wheels.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / ye shes kyi dbye ba'am /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / ye shes kyi dbye ba'am /
translated: The four are differentiated by the divisions of earth, water, fire, wind, space, and gnosis.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi dbye ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi dbye ba'am /
translated: Or, they are differentiated by the divisions of form, feeling, perception, formation, consciousness, and gnosis.🔽Or, they are differentiated by the divisions of the six syllables.

original: yi ge drug gi dbye bas phye ba yin te dang po mchog gi sangs rgyas kyi rgyud kyi don to //
analyzed: yi ge drug gi dbye bas phye ba yin te dang po mchog gi sangs rgyas kyi rgyud kyi don to //
translated: The first is the meaning of the Supreme Buddha Tantra.

original: gang du bzhir bstan pa ni sprul pa drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / chos brgyad dang / longs spyod bcu drug dang / bde ba chen po sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang du bzhir bstan pa ni sprul pa drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / chos brgyad dang / longs spyod bcu drug dang / bde ba chen po sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa ste /
translated: Where it is taught as four, it is the sixty-four emanations, the eight dharmas, the sixteen enjoyments, the thirty-two great joys, and so forth.

original: de ltar 'khor lo bzhi'i dbye ba dang / sku bzhi dang / dbang bzhi dang / dga' ba bzhi dang / skad cig ma bzhi dang / 'bras bu bzhi la sogs pa'i bye brag gis kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud du bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo bzhi'i dbye ba dang / sku bzhi dang / dbang bzhi dang / dga' ba bzhi dang / skad cig ma bzhi dang / 'bras bu bzhi la sogs pa'i bye brag gis kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud du bstan te /
translated: Thus, it is taught in the Hevajra Tantra by the distinctions of the four cakras, the four bodies, the four empowerments, the four joys, the four moments, the four results, and so forth.

original: de ltar thams cad bzhi bzhi'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad bzhi bzhi'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is said, Everything is fourfold.

original: de bas na phyi rol du ni sha dang khrag la rgyug par byed pa grong la brten pa'i lha mo rnams ni phyi'i gnas de dag na gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol du ni sha dang khrag la rgyug par byed pa grong la brten pa'i lha mo rnams ni phyi'i gnas de dag na gnas pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the goddesses who run about in the external world, drinking blood and flesh, live in those external abodes.

original: ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin nang //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin nang //
translated: And as it is said, “Just as without, so within,”

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir @53b nang gi gnas ni lus la rtsa'i gzugs kyis gnas par gsungs te de las gzhan du mi blta'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir @53b nang gi gnas ni lus la rtsa'i gzugs kyis gnas par gsungs te de las gzhan du mi blta'o //
translated: the internal abodes are said to live in the body in the form of channels, and should not be viewed as otherwise.

original: de yang lus la ni dz'a la ndha ra zhes pa nas skyed tshal rab rdzing bu'i 'gram zhes pa yan chad 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang lus la ni dz'a la ndha ra zhes pa nas skyed tshal rab rdzing bu'i 'gram zhes pa yan chad 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, in the body, from the Jalandhara to the “garden by the pond,”

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las ji skad du /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las ji skad du /
translated: as it is said in the Root Tantra:🔽The crown of the head, the fontanelle, the right ear, the right shoulder,

original: spyi bo dang ni spyi gtsug dang // rna ba g-yas pa rtsi ba logs dang // de bzhin sna tshogs smin dbus dang // lag pa mchan khung dag dang ni //
analyzed: spyi bo dang ni spyi gtsug dang // rna ba g-yas pa rtsi ba logs dang // de bzhin sna tshogs smin dbus dang // lag pa mchan khung dag dang ni //
translated: and likewise the middle of the brow, the hand, the armpit,

original: nu ma gnyis dang lte ba dang / sna rtse dang ni kha yi lam //
analyzed: nu ma gnyis dang lte ba dang / sna rtse dang ni kha yi lam //
translated: the two breasts, the navel, the tip of the nose, the mouth,🔽and the secret place, the anus, the two thighs,🔽and the two feet are the twenty-four sacred sites.

original: phrag gong gnyis dang pho mtshan dang // rtags dang bshang lam brang gi gnas //
analyzed: phrag gong gnyis dang pho mtshan dang // rtags dang bshang lam brang gi gnas //
translated: The two shoulders, the male organ, the anus, and the chest.

original: byin pa dang ni sor mo dang / rkang pa'i bo la dang mthe bong dang // pus mo rnams su go rims bzhin //🔽gnas dang sa sogs blta bar bya //
analyzed: byin pa dang ni sor mo dang / rkang pa'i bo la dang mthe bong dang // pus mo rnams su go rims bzhin // gnas dang sa sogs blta bar bya //
translated: The thighs, fingers, the soles of the feet, the big toes, and the knees,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: in order, are the places of the earth and so on.

original: de bas na de'i phyir sems can rnams la spyod pa dang grol ba'i 'bras bu ster ba'i lha mo dang gnas 'di rnams ni lus can thams cad kyi lus nyid la rtsa dang khu ba'i gzugs kyi gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na de'i phyir sems can rnams la spyod pa dang grol ba'i 'bras bu ster ba'i lha mo dang gnas 'di rnams ni lus can thams cad kyi lus nyid la rtsa dang khu ba'i gzugs kyi gnas so //
translated: Thus, therefore, these places and goddesses, which bestow the fruits of conduct and liberation on sentient beings, are in the bodies of all embodied beings in the form of channels and fluids.

original: da ni nyi ma'i dus kyi khyad par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nyi ma'i dus kyi khyad par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to describe the distinctions of solar time,

original: rnal 'byor ma rgyud kyi rdo rjer //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rgyud kyi rdo rjer //
translated: in the Vajra of the Yoginī Tantra,

original: rnal 'byor ma yi legs 'du ba'i //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma yi legs 'du ba'i //
translated: the excellent gathering of yoginīs,

original: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //
translated: for the sake of all sentient beings,

original: nyin mo'i dus kyang rab bshad bya //
analyzed: nyin mo'i dus kyang rab bshad bya //
translated: the time of day is also explained.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dir nyi ma'i dus ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dir nyi ma'i dus ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, solar time is twofold:

original: phyi dang nang gi'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi'o //
translated: outer and inner.

original: de la phyi'i zla ba mar gyi ngo'i bcu bzhi la sogs pa la grong gi lha mo rnams gong du brjod pa'i phyi'i gnas rnams su lus can thams cad kyi mdangs 'brog par bya ba'i phyir rgyu ba yin la /
analyzed: de la phyi'i zla ba mar gyi ngo'i bcu bzhi la sogs pa la grong gi lha mo rnams gong du brjod pa'i phyi'i gnas rnams su lus can thams cad kyi mdangs 'brog par bya ba'i phyir rgyu ba yin la /
translated: On the fourteenth day of the waning phase of the moon, the village goddesses move to the external places mentioned above in order to steal the radiance of all embodied beings.

original: nang du ni khu ba dang rlung la sogs pa dbugs dang chu srang dang chu tshod la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi gnas su 'phro zhing 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang du ni khu ba dang rlung la sogs pa dbugs dang chu srang dang chu tshod la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi gnas su 'phro zhing 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Internally, semen, wind, and so forth move and gather in the places of the distinctions of breaths, finger lengths, hours, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du dngos grub gnyis la 'dun pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang phyi dang nang gi bye brag shes par byas la /🔽thun mong gi dngos grub kyi don du mar ngo'i bcu bzhi la sogs pa la mtshan mo dur khrod du song ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos grub gnyis la 'dun pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang phyi dang nang gi bye brag shes par byas la / thun mong gi dngos grub kyi don du mar ngo'i bcu bzhi la sogs pa la mtshan mo dur khrod du song ste /
translated: Likewise, the yogī who aspires to the two feats should understand the distinctions of the external and internal.

original: dpa' bo'i ston mo la sogs pa la 'du bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i ston mo la sogs pa la 'du bar bya ba yin no //
translated: For the sake of the common feat, on the fourteenth day of the waning phase, and so forth, at night one should go to the charnel ground and gather for the hero’s feast, and so forth.

original: de ni 'di ltar kye bcom ldan 'das nyi ma gang lags zhes bya ba smos te phyi dang nang gi nyi ma'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar kye bcom ldan 'das nyi ma gang lags zhes bya ba smos te phyi dang nang gi nyi ma'o //
translated: Thus, “O Bhagavān, what is the sun?” refers to the external and internal sun.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: mar gyi ngo yi bcu bzhi dang / de bzhin du yang brgyad pa nyid //
analyzed: mar gyi ngo yi bcu bzhi dang / de bzhin du yang brgyad pa nyid //
translated: The fourteenth of the waning phase, and likewise the eighth itself,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is said to be the time for the yoginīs to gather.

original: mar ngo'i bcu bzhi ni nyi shu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: mar ngo'i bcu bzhi ni nyi shu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: The fourteenth of the waning phase is the twenty-ninth.

original: de bzhin du mar ngo'i brgyad ni nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mar ngo'i brgyad ni nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: Likewise, the eighth of the waning phase is the twenty-third.

original: de yang nges pa'i don ni rtsa ba'i rgyud nyid la 'jug par @54a * //
analyzed: de yang nges pa'i don ni rtsa ba'i rgyud nyid la 'jug par @54a * //
translated: Moreover, the definitive meaning should be understood from the root tantra itself.

original: bya ste / ji skad du /
analyzed: bya ste / ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: byang chub sems kyi zla ba 'di //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi zla ba 'di //
translated: This moon of bodhicitta

original: yar ngo mar ngo rab tu gnas //
analyzed: yar ngo mar ngo rab tu gnas //
translated: Resides in the waxing and waning phases.

original: yar ngo yis ni skyed byed ma //
analyzed: yar ngo yis ni skyed byed ma //
translated: The waxing phase gives rise to it,

original: mar ngo yis ni 'joms byed ma //
analyzed: mar ngo yis ni 'joms byed ma //
translated: while the waning phase destroys it.

original: mar ngo'i bcu bzhi la sogs kyis //
analyzed: mar ngo'i bcu bzhi la sogs kyis //
translated: On the fourteenth of the waning phase and so forth,

analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod min lhan cig skyes //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: yar ngo mar ngo 'dod chags dang chags pa dang bral ba yin zhing /

analyzed: dbu ma cha bcu drug pa yin zhing dngos su na nyi ma dang / zla ba dang sgra gcan zhe'am /

analyzed: cha shas dang / thig le dang / sgra zhes gang yang mtshon par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Or it is the part, the drop, and the sound.

analyzed: de bas na de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la zhen pa rnams kyis bla ma ma @60b gtogs pa rnyed par mi 'gyur te /

original: bla ma'i rjes su 'brang bar bstan to //
analyzed: bla ma'i rjes su 'brang bar bstan to //

analyzed: 'di ltar / gang du yang ni mi rnyed de //

analyzed: bla ma'i dus thabs bstan pa yis // bdag gi bsod nams las shes bya //

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: mtshon bya sngon du rnyed nas 'di ltar blta bar bya ste /

analyzed: dman pa 'bring dang mchog rnams dang // gzhan dang gang rnams de rnams kyang //

original: ro mnyam de nyid bsgoms pa yi //
analyzed: ro mnyam de nyid bsgoms pa yi //

original: 'di kun mnyam pa nyid du blta //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di kun mnyam pa nyid du blta // zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: mdor bstan pa'o //

translated: By this vajra statement, those who have found the object of illustration should abandon the notion of the subtle, the notion of the coarse, and the notion of the middle with regard to the three worlds of moving and unmoving beings.

original: mtshon du med par mtshon par bya bar ston to //
analyzed: mtshon du med par mtshon par bya bar ston to //

original: ji skad du rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang ;
analyzed: ji skad du rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang ;

analyzed: rig pa'i skyes bu blo ldan gyis //

original: sgra dang thig le rnams spangs te //
analyzed: sgra dang thig le rnams spangs te //

original: mtshon du med par mtshon byas nas //
analyzed: mtshon du med par mtshon byas nas //

analyzed: kye yi rdo rje'i skur 'dzin 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: dman pa rnams ni phra ba'i don //

analyzed: mchog gi dngos por brjod par bya //

analyzed: dbu ma gnyis kyis spangs pa nyid //

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: mi rgyu ba bstan pa'i dngos po rnams sam yang na 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams su lta ba'i shes pa'am /

analyzed: gzhan rnams zhes bya dbang po drug / gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo //

analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i ror mnyam pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di kun zhes bya ba nyid med //

analyzed: mnyam nyid mtshungs par 'dod pa ste /

analyzed: ro mnyam de nyid bsgom pa ni //

analyzed: mnyam zhes bya ba mtshungs par brjod //

original: mtshan ma'i rtog pa byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rtog pa byung ba yin no //

original: mar me'i rtse mo @63b lta bur bcing //
analyzed: mar me'i rtse mo @63b lta bur bcing //

analyzed: de bzhin du kha thur du bltas pa'i chu bo yang mar me'i rtse mo ltar dbyer med pa'i lam du bsgyur par bya ste /

analyzed: chu bran mdog dang ro dang dbyibs tha dad pa gang+g'a si ta la sogs pa phyi'i dug can du chud pa na tha mi dad pa bzhin no //

original: rtag tu de nyid rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: rtag tu de nyid rnal 'byor gyis //

original: nyin dang mtshan du rnam par gzhag / ces bya ba ni dngos po rnams ro gcig pa'i de kho na nyid la spyod lam thams cad du gzhag ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'dir mang smras pas ci zhig bya //

analyzed: blo yi yul du gang gyur pa //

analyzed: de dag ro mnyam bsgom par bya //

analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'i rgya cher bshad pa ste brgyad pa'o /

original: // / dngos med ngo bo las byung ba //
analyzed: // / dngos med ngo bo las byung ba //

original: rnam dag le'u rgyas bshad ni //
analyzed: rnam dag le'u rgyas bshad ni //

original: rdo rje snying pos bri bar bya //
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos bri bar bya //

analyzed: de bas 'di ltar gsang chen rnam pa gsum gyi tshul gyis /

translated: then the chapter on the supreme purification will be explained means that after the explanation of the Yoginī Wheel, the meaning is then.

analyzed: nges par dngos po thams cad kyi //

analyzed: zhes pa ni khams gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad do // dag pa de bzhin nyid du brjod //

analyzed: de yang re zhig byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /

original: lha rnams kyis ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis ni brjod par bya //

analyzed: de ni 'di @64a * //

original: 'di nyid de //🔽phya nas ra rer dbya  ba yis //
analyzed: 'di nyid de // phya nas ra rer dbya  ba yis //

analyzed: lha rnams kyis ni brjod par bya //

analyzed: phung po lnga dang dbang po drug / skye mched drug dang 'byung chen lnga //

analyzed: de las phung po lnga dang zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po dang skye mched dang 'byung ba chen po la sogs ba rnams /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rig ma lnga rnams su sbyang ngo //

analyzed: nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib sbyang bya //

original: rang rig bdag nyid dag pa nyid //
analyzed: rang rig bdag nyid dag pa nyid //

original: dag pa gzhan gyis rnam grol min //
analyzed: dag pa gzhan gyis rnam grol min //

analyzed: de la ji ltar dag par bya zhe na //

original: rang rig bdag nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang rig bdag nyid ces bya ba smos te /

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med par shes pa gang yin pa ni /

original: dag pa zhes de la brjod de //
analyzed: dag pa zhes de la brjod de //
translated: is called purity.

analyzed: de ma rtogs pa gzhan gyis dag par mi bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //

original: de bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas de'i phyir /

analyzed: yul gyi dngos por dag pa'i phyir //

analyzed: rang gis rig pa'i bde ba'i mchog / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams dang // gzhan yang rnal 'byor bas mthong ba //

analyzed: dngos po de kun dag pa ste //

analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs rnam par snang mdzad ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: Thus, by the words “form is Vairocana,” and so on.

original: de'i phyir dpag bsam gyi shing dang / bum pa bzang po dang // yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / ral gri la sogs par snang zhing don byed pa'i yul rnam par sbyang ste byis pa rnams la drang bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpag bsam gyi shing dang / bum pa bzang po dang // yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / ral gri la sogs par snang zhing don byed pa'i yul rnam par sbyang ste byis pa rnams la drang bar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the objects that appear and function as the objects of the childish, such as the wish-fulfilling tree, the excellent vase, the wish-fulfilling jewel, the sword, and so on, are purified and explained to be the objects to be interpreted.🔽“

analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das rnam par ma dag pa gang lags zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje snying po'i lan du'o //

analyzed: de ci'i slang du zhe na zhes pa ni rdo rje snying po slar gsol pa'o //

analyzed: zhes zhus pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes pa ni lan du'o //

analyzed: mig gis gzugs la 'dzin par byed //
translated: “The eye apprehends form.

analyzed: sgra la rna bas nyan par byed // sna yis dri la snom par byed //
translated: The ear listens to sound.🔽The nose smells smells.

original: lce yis rol myong bar byed //
analyzed: lce yis rol myong bar byed //

analyzed: dngos po kun gyis reg par byed // ces gsungs te /

analyzed: de nyid thabs gyis  'jug par byed de /

original: des rnam par dag go //
analyzed: des rnam par dag go //

original: 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad ni /

analyzed: gang gis de ltar shes pa de ni rnam par sbyangs pa ste nges pa'i don to //

analyzed: des na / yid kyis bde sogs thob pa rnams //
translated: having made the attainment of mental happiness and so forth

analyzed: dag pas dug med byas nas ni //

analyzed: bsten bya 'di dag bsten par bya //

analyzed: rang rang ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bstan to //

analyzed: de bzhin du las dang po bdag gis ni bdag @65a * //

original: dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ni /
translated: the self and mine,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rus dang rigs dang rgyu dang cho 'brang du 'dzin pa las bzlog ste /

analyzed: rigs bzhi po rnams nang phan tshun du go dang / ku la sogs pa'i bza' ba dag thun mong du bza' zhing /

translated: and one should have intercourse with those of the same and different families.

original: ma dang sring mo la sogs pa rnams dang lhan cig tu gnas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma dang sring mo la sogs pa rnams dang lhan cig tu gnas par bya ba ste /
translated: One should dwell together with one’s mother, sister, and so forth.

original: gang des tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa cher rags pa rnams las ldog go //
analyzed: gang des tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa cher rags pa rnams las ldog go //
translated: By that, one turns away from the coarse, ordinary concepts.

original: de bas na rdo rje'i rigs ni mngon par dbang bskur ba bdun nyid kyis ming 'thob po //
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje'i rigs ni mngon par dbang bskur ba bdun nyid kyis ming 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, the vajra family obtains its name by means of the seven secret initiations.

original: des na bdag cag rnams kyis phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / dbang po dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa ji snyed pa dang / de bzhin du las dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba rnams lha nyid du brtag gis /
analyzed: des na bdag cag rnams kyis phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / dbang po dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa ji snyed pa dang / de bzhin du las dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba rnams lha nyid du brtag gis /
translated: Therefore, we should consider all the aggregates, elements, sense bases, faculties, elements, and derivative elements, as well as all the actions of the faculties and their objects, to be deities.

original: de las gzhan gyi tshul du mi brtag ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan gyi tshul du mi brtag ste /
translated: We should not consider them in any other way.

original: de ltar na dang po'i las can gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de ltar na dang po'i las can gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis /
translated: Thus, yogins and yoginīs who are beginners

original: gzugs phung rdo rje ma yin te //
analyzed: gzugs phung rdo rje ma yin te //
translated: should consider the aggregate of form to be Vajragarvā.

original: tshor ba la yang dkar mor brjod //🔽'du shes chu yi rnal 'byor ma //🔽'du byed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: tshor ba la yang dkar mor brjod // 'du shes chu yi rnal 'byor ma // 'du byed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: They should also consider feeling to be Pāṇḍaravāsinī.🔽They should consider perception to be Vāriyoginī.🔽They should consider formation to be Vajraḍāka.

original: rnam shes phung po'i tshul gyis ni ;🔽/ bdag med rnal 'byor ma gnas so //
analyzed: rnam shes phung po'i tshul gyis ni ; / bdag med rnal 'byor ma gnas so //
translated: And they should consider consciousness to be Nairātmyāyoginī.

original: rtag tu 'di dag rnam dag pas /
analyzed: rtag tu 'di dag rnam dag pas /
translated: Always pure in this way,

original: de nyid rnal 'byor pas 'grub 'gyur /🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor pas 'grub 'gyur /🔽zhes gsungs te /
translated: the yogin will attain the state of union.

original: 'di ltar shel gyi nor bu'i nye 'khor du kha dog gang dang gang gzhag pa de dang de'i kha dog tu 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shel gyi nor bu'i nye 'khor du kha dog gang dang gang gzhag pa de dang de'i kha dog tu 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as a crystal gem becomes the color of whatever is placed next to it.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos kyang byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos kyang byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba la /
translated: And also the Great Vajradhara said to the Bodhisattva Vajradhātu:

original: rigs kyi bu sems de ni ji ltar sbyangs pa de ltar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems de ni ji ltar sbyangs pa de ltar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Son of the family, the mind becomes whatever it is purified as.”

original: 'di'i phyir ni phung po lnga lha mo lnga ru brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir ni phung po lnga lha mo lnga ru brtag par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the five aggregates should be imagined as the five goddesses.

original: nang gi tshul du bstan pa ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lor rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: nang gi tshul du bstan pa ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lor rgyas par bstan to //
translated: The inner way of teaching this is taught extensively in the Yoginī Wheel.

original: de ni nang gi 'phar ma ste phung bo lnga dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nang gi 'phar ma ste phung bo lnga dag pa'o //
translated: That is the inner courtyard, the purity of the five aggregates.

original: yul rnams lha ru brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yul rnams lha ru brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to imagine the objects as gods,

original: de nas phyi yi 'phar ma bshad //
analyzed: de nas phyi yi 'phar ma bshad //
translated: then the outer courtyard is explained.

original: dbang ldan du ni pu kka s'i //
analyzed: dbang ldan du ni pu kka s'i //
translated: In the northeast is Pukkasī,

original: mer ni de bzhin ri khrod ma //🔽bden bral gdol pa mo bzhag cing //
analyzed: mer ni de bzhin ri khrod ma //🔽bden bral gdol pa mo bzhag cing //
translated: in the east is likewise Śavarī,🔽in the southeast is Caṇḍālī,🔽and in the south is Ḍombinī.

original: rlung du g-yung mo rnam par gzhag / ces pas ni 'byung ba bzhi'i lha mo bstan to //
analyzed: rlung du g-yung mo rnam par gzhag / ces pas ni 'byung ba bzhi'i lha mo bstan to //
translated: This teaches the goddesses of the four elements.

original: de bzhin du @65b yul gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhi'i lha ru brtag pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽dbang dkar gshin rjer chom rkun ma //🔽chu yi phyogs su ro langs ma //
analyzed: de bzhin du @65b yul gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhi'i lha ru brtag pa ni 'di lta ste / dbang dkar gshin rjer chom rkun ma // chu yi phyogs su ro langs ma //
translated: Similarly, the four elements are imagined as the goddesses of the four elements, form, etc.🔽In the east, Pukkasi, in the south, Caṇḍālī, in the west, Ḍombinī, in the north, Ḍākinī.

original: lus ngan du ni gha sma r'i //🔽zhes pas bstan to //
analyzed: lus ngan du ni gha sma r'i // zhes pas bstan to //
translated: In the southeast, Ghasmarī, in the southwest, Pukkasī, in the northwest, Caṇḍālī, in the northeast, Ḍombinī.

original: gzhan yang // 'og tu sa spyod ma zhes brjod //
analyzed: gzhan yang // 'og tu sa spyod ma zhes brjod //
translated: In the lower direction, one should know, is called the Earth-faring Goddess.

original: steng du mkha' spyod ma zhes bshad //
analyzed: steng du mkha' spyod ma zhes bshad //
translated: In the upper direction, the Sky-faring Goddess.

original: ces pa ni phyi nang gi tshul gyis gong du rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: ces pa ni phyi nang gi tshul gyis gong du rgyas par bstan to //
translated: This is taught extensively above in terms of the outer and inner.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa nyid kyi phyogs zhes bya ba ni de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas las dang po pa rnams la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa nyid kyi phyogs zhes bya ba ni de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas las dang po pa rnams la bstan pa'o //
translated: The “side of the creation stage” is the teaching for beginners by the process of expression.

original: srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis // zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the nature of existence and peace,

original: srid pa ni mkha' spyod ma yin la zhi ba ni sa spyod ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa ni mkha' spyod ma yin la zhi ba ni sa spyod ma yin no //
translated: existence is the Sky-faring Goddess, and peace is the Earth-faring Goddess.

original: de yang rgyud gzhan las ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang rgyud gzhan las ji skad du /
translated: And in another tantra, it is said:

original: srid pa ni dpral ba yin zhing mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
analyzed: srid pa ni dpral ba yin zhing mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
translated: Existence is the forehead, and nirvana

original: nor bu'i mgrin pa las zags par 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nor bu'i mgrin pa las zags par 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: is the dripping from the throat of the gem.

original: lha mo 'di gnyis rnam par gnas //
analyzed: lha mo 'di gnyis rnam par gnas //
translated: These two goddesses are situated🔽in the nature of existence and peace.

original: zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin du steng dang 'og gi lha mo gnyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin du steng dang 'og gi lha mo gnyis shes par bya'o //
translated: The two goddesses above and below should be understood as the nature of existence and peace.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la rnam par dag par bstan pa byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la rnam par dag par bstan pa byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The teaching on the purity of the creation stage is to be understood by the childish.

original: gzugs la dkar mor brtag par bshad //
analyzed: gzugs la dkar mor brtag par bshad //
translated: It is explained that form is to be regarded as Gaurī,

original: sgra la chom rkun ma ru grags //🔽dri yi cha la ro langs ma //
analyzed: sgra la chom rkun ma ru grags // dri yi cha la ro langs ma //
translated: sound is renowned as Caṇḍālī,🔽the part of smell is Vetālī,

original: ro la gha sma r'i ru grags //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: ro la gha sma r'i ru grags // zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: and taste is renowned as Ghasmarī.

original: byis pas brtags pa'i dngos po bzhi po rnams de ltar mos par byas te goms pa las kun rdzob tu gsad pa la sogs pa grub pa yang yin la /
analyzed: byis pas brtags pa'i dngos po bzhi po rnams de ltar mos par byas te goms pa las kun rdzob tu gsad pa la sogs pa grub pa yang yin la /
translated: One should imagine the four things imagined by the childish in this way, and through cultivation, one will accomplish the conventional killing and so forth.

original: las 'di bzhi'i nges pa'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: las 'di bzhi'i nges pa'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The definitive meaning of these four actions is taught.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las 'di lta ste /
translated: The Root Tantra says:

original: rdo rje snying po lus can rnams kyi rang gi lus las 'byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi chus nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba zhi bar byed pa ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po lus can rnams kyi rang gi lus las 'byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi chus nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba zhi bar byed pa ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhicitta that arises from the body of embodied beings, the essence of the vajra, is pacifying because it pacifies the torment of the afflictions with the water of bodhicitta.

original: snga na med pa'i bde ba gya nom pas lus dang ngag dang sems rgyas pa'i phyir rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i bde ba gya nom pas lus dang ngag dang sems rgyas pa'i phyir rgyas pa'o //
translated: It is enriching because the body, voice, and mind are expanded by the bliss of the previously nonexistent sublime.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid sdug bsngal ba las bzlog ste bde bas dbang du byas pa'i phyir dbang ngo //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid sdug bsngal ba las bzlog ste bde bas dbang du byas pa'i phyir dbang ngo //
translated: It is powerful because the body, voice, and mind are brought under control by bliss, which turns away from suffering.

original: de stobs kyis srog nyi khri chig stong rgyu ba dang // byang chub sems kyi thig le kha thur du bltas pa'i rgyu ba gsod pa'i phyir mngon spyod do //
analyzed: de stobs kyis srog nyi khri chig stong rgyu ba dang // byang chub sems kyi thig le kha thur du bltas pa'i rgyu ba gsod pa'i phyir mngon spyod do //
translated: It is wrathful because it kills the downward-facing bindu of bodhicitta and the movement of the twenty-one thousand life-upholding vāyus.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: zhi ba chu yi bsam gtan dpral bar bsam pa dang / dbang me'i bsam gtan mgrin par bsam pa dang // gsang ba rlung gi bsam gtan snying ga dang // @66a * //
analyzed: zhi ba chu yi bsam gtan dpral bar bsam pa dang / dbang me'i bsam gtan mgrin par bsam pa dang // gsang ba rlung gi bsam gtan snying ga dang // @66a * //
translated: the concentration of water for pacifying is imagined at the forehead, the concentration of fire for powerful is imagined at the throat, and the secret concentration of air is imagined at the heart.

original: rgyas pa sa yi bsam gtan lte bar gnas //
analyzed: rgyas pa sa yi bsam gtan lte bar gnas //
translated: The extensive one is the earth concentration, abiding in the navel.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: reg pas spyod ma zhes bshad //
analyzed: reg pas spyod ma zhes bshad //
translated: The one who moves in the sky is explained as the one who moves in the sky.

original: chos kyi dbyings la mkha' spyod ma /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la mkha' spyod ma /
translated: The one who moves in the sky is the realm of phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi tshul gyis rnam par shes pa nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba srog gi rlung steng nas rgyu ba rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi de kho na nyid de 'dus pa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid du bstan zhing pha'i sems🔽zhes su bstan no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi tshul gyis rnam par shes pa nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba srog gi rlung steng nas rgyu ba rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi de kho na nyid de 'dus pa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid du bstan zhing pha'i sems zhes su bstan no //
translated: The consciousness by the method of outer and inner is the realm of space, the life-force wind moving above, the reality of the yoga tantras, taught as the reality of the Guhyasamaja, and so on, and taught as the father's mind.

original: de bzhin du sa spyod ma zhes bya ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi khams zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa spyod ma zhes bya ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi khams zhes bya ba /
translated: Similarly, the one who moves on the earth is the realm of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: lus can rnams kyi khu ba'i thig le 'og tu 'dzag pa'i bde ba rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi khu ba'i thig le 'og tu 'dzag pa'i bde ba rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi de kho na nyid de /
translated: The bliss of the dripping of the seminal drop below of embodied beings is the reality of the yogini tantras,

original: kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid du bstan cing ma'i sems su bstan to //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid du bstan cing ma'i sems su bstan to //
translated: taught as the reality of the Hevajra, and so on, and taught as the mother's mind.

original: de ni dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud ces bya ba las kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: de ni dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud ces bya ba las kyang ji skad du /
translated: It is also said in the Tantra of the Primordial Buddha:

original: steng 'og sems kyi rtsa gnyis ni //
analyzed: steng 'og sems kyi rtsa gnyis ni //
translated: The two channels of the mind above and below

original: sa bon 'bab dang mun pa can //
analyzed: sa bon 'bab dang mun pa can //
translated: Are the seed-fall and the dark.

original: thabs kyi thugs ni mun pa can //
analyzed: thabs kyi thugs ni mun pa can //
translated: The mind of means is the dark,

original: sa bon 'bab pa shes rab kyi /🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sa bon 'bab pa shes rab kyi / zhes gsungs te /
translated: And the seed-fall is the wisdom.

original: rdo rje'i tshig 'dis don 'di khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig 'dis don 'di khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This meaning should be understood from these vajra words.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And also:

original: rtag tu 'di rnams rnam dag pas //
analyzed: rtag tu 'di rnams rnam dag pas //
translated: By always purifying these,

original: de nyid rnal 'byor pas 'grub 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi dbang gis /
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor pas 'grub 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi dbang gis /
translated: The yogin will attain reality.🔽This means that by taking to mind the provisional and definitive meanings,

original: rim pa bzhin du yid la byas nas /
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du yid la byas nas /
translated: respectively,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid rim bzhin du thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid rim bzhin du thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one will attain the mundane and supramundane realities, respectively.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang / phyag gi dag pa stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gzhan yang / phyag gi dag pa stong pa nyid //
translated: The purity of the hands is emptiness,

original: bdud rnams dag pas zhabs rnams te //
analyzed: bdud rnams dag pas zhabs rnams te //
translated: The purity of the feet is the māras,

original: rnam thar brgyad kyi zhal rnams yin //
analyzed: rnam thar brgyad kyi zhal rnams yin //
translated: The purity of the faces is the eight liberations,

original: spyan gyi dag pas rdo rje gsum //
analyzed: spyan gyi dag pas rdo rje gsum //
translated: The purity of the eyes is the three vajras,

original: zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du zla ba mar ngo'i chos can stong pa nyid bcu drug dang / 'jig rten pa'i sad pa la sogs pa'i chos can gnas skabs bzhi 'gags pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo thun mtshams brgyad kyi mtshan nyid can dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du zla ba mar ngo'i chos can stong pa nyid bcu drug dang / 'jig rten pa'i sad pa la sogs pa'i chos can gnas skabs bzhi 'gags pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo thun mtshams brgyad kyi mtshan nyid can dang /
translated: These are, respectively, the sixteen emptinesses, which are characterized by the waning moon, the four states characterized by worldly sleep, etc., which are interrupted, the characteristics of the eight periods of the wheel of Dharma,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid can aom a'a: h'um zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid can aom a'a: h'um zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: and the characteristics of body, speech, and mind, which are Oṃ, Āḥ, and Hūṃ, and also

original: sa ni pu kka s'i zhes bshad //
analyzed: sa ni pu kka s'i zhes bshad //
translated: the earth is said to be Pukkasī,

original: chu khams rngon pa ma zhes brjod //
analyzed: chu khams rngon pa ma zhes brjod //
translated: the water element is said to be Śavarī,

original: me ni gtum mor shes par bya //
analyzed: me ni gtum mor shes par bya //
translated: fire is known as Caṇḍālī,

original: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu grags //
analyzed: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu grags //
translated: and air is renowned as Ḍombinī.

original: zhes pa ni las rnam pa bzhi'i tshul gyis phyi dang nang du rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni las rnam pa bzhi'i tshul gyis phyi dang nang du rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood externally and internally by way of the four types of action.🔽The definitive meaning is as follows.

original: nges pa'i don ni 'di ltar rtsa ba'i rgyud nyid las /
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni 'di ltar rtsa ba'i rgyud nyid las /
translated: In the Root Tantra itself,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: it says:

original: srog ni rdo rje'i rigs kyis bcad //
analyzed: srog ni rdo rje'i rigs kyis bcad //
translated: Life is cut by the vajra family,

original: don yod grub @66b pas brdzun du smra //
analyzed: don yod grub @66b pas brdzun du smra //
translated: lies are told by Amoghasiddhi,

original: rin po che yis brku bar bya //
analyzed: rin po che yis brku bar bya //
translated: stealing is done by Ratnasaṃbhava,🔽and

original: dpag med 'od kyis mi tshangs spyad //
analyzed: dpag med 'od kyis mi tshangs spyad //
translated: The one of immeasurable light is celibacy.

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ni /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ni /
translated: By knowing it just as it is,

original: dngos grub gnyis kyi rgyur dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos grub gnyis kyi rgyur dgongs so //
translated: it is intended as the cause of the two powers.

original: de bzhin du gtso bo dang phal ba'i dbye bas /🔽zhe sdang zhes bshad rdo rje ma //🔽'dod chags chu yi rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtso bo dang phal ba'i dbye bas / zhe sdang zhes bshad rdo rje ma // 'dod chags chu yi rnal 'byor ma //
translated: Likewise, by the division of principal and secondary,🔽it is said that the vajra is explained as anger,🔽the water is desire,

original: phrag dog rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: phrag dog rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: the ḍākinī is jealousy,

original: ser sna gsang ba'i dkar mo nyid //
analyzed: ser sna gsang ba'i dkar mo nyid //
translated: the secret white one is miserliness,

original: de bzhin gti mug rdo rje ma //
analyzed: de bzhin gti mug rdo rje ma //
translated: and likewise the vajra is stupidity.

original: zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ba dang / don yod grub pa dang / dpag med 'od dang / rnam snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams su rnal 'byor sde gnyis kyis rtogs par bya bar gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ba dang / don yod grub pa dang / dpag med 'od dang / rnam snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams su rnal 'byor sde gnyis kyis rtogs par bya bar gsungs te /
translated: Thus, in order, the two sets of six are said to be realized by the two sets of yogīs and yoginīs of Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amoghasiddhi, Amitābha, Vairocana, and so on.

original: 'on kyang skabs 'di las byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang skabs 'di las byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
translated: However, in this context, they are taught for the realization of the yogīs and yoginīs of the stage of generation.

original: ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ci mngon zhe na /
translated: What is the evidence?

original: zhe sdang la sogs rnam sbyong ba //
