analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha mo'i mtshan ma dgod pa'i tshul te /
translated: This is the method of placing the signs of the goddesses.

original: 'phar ma rnam pa gnyis la rim pa bzhin du yul dang yul can gyi lha mo rnams kyi phyag mtshan dgod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phar ma rnam pa gnyis la rim pa bzhin du yul dang yul can gyi lha mo rnams kyi phyag mtshan dgod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the hand implements of the goddesses, both objective and subjective, are placed in the two layers in order.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: dbang ldan du ni ci gsungs pa //
analyzed: dbang ldan du ni ci gsungs pa //
translated: whatever is said in the northeast,

original: de lta de ltar 'og dang steng //
analyzed: de lta de ltar 'og dang steng //
translated: that is the same below and above.

original: zhes bya bas ni lha mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma la sogs pa legs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni lha mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma la sogs pa legs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the signs of the maṇḍala of goddesses and so forth.

original: da ni slob dpon rig sngags 'chang ba bdag nyid dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon rig sngags 'chang ba bdag nyid dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ston te /
translated: Now, it teaches the master, the knowledge-mantra bearer, entering the maṇḍala.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / rdo rje sems dpa' bsnyems byas nas //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rdo rje sems dpa' bsnyems byas nas //
translated: Having assumed the pride of Vajrasattva,

original: rkang pa g-yas pa brkyang bya ste //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pa brkyang bya ste //
translated: one should extend the right leg,

original: phyag gnyis kye'i rdo rjer sbyor bas //
analyzed: phyag gnyis kye'i rdo rjer sbyor bas //
translated: and with the two hands in the gesture of the vajra fist,

original: snying rje'i gar thabs dang ldan pa //
analyzed: snying rje'i gar thabs dang ldan pa //
translated: endowed with the dance-like gait of compassion,

original: slob dpon dkyil 'khor 'jug par bya //
analyzed: slob dpon dkyil 'khor 'jug par bya //
translated: the master should enter the maṇḍala.

original: ces bya bas ston te 'di ltar rig sngags 'chang thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i snying rje bskyed de /
analyzed: ces bya bas ston te 'di ltar rig sngags 'chang thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i snying rje bskyed de /
translated: Thus, the knowledge-mantra bearer, through the yoga of non-dual method and wisdom, generates the compassion that is the same towards all sentient beings.

original: snying rje'i gar stabs dang ldan pas dkyil 'khor du 'jug ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: snying rje'i gar stabs dang ldan pas dkyil 'khor du 'jug ces pa'i don to //
translated: With the dance-like gait of compassion, one should enter the maṇḍala. This is the meaning.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang / khrus dang gtsang spra dri zhim lus //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khrus dang gtsang spra dri zhim lus //
translated: Having bathed, pure, with a fragrant body,

original: sna tshogs rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: adorned with various ornaments,

original: zhes bya ba yang tshul bzhin du byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang tshul bzhin du byas la /
translated: This is also done in the proper way.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bgegs gzhil bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bgegs gzhil bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the obstacles of conceptual thought,

original: h'um h'um bsnyems pa byas nas ni //
analyzed: h'um h'um bsnyems pa byas nas ni //
translated: one should do the arrogant hūṃ hūṃ

original: h'i h'i rnam par 'jigs par byed //
analyzed: h'i h'i rnam par 'jigs par byed //
translated: and the terrifying hā hā.

original: ces bya ba zhal nas brjod cing dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i las bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba zhal nas brjod cing dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i las bya ba ni /
translated: Reciting this from one’s mouth, one should perform the activities of entering the maṇḍala, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definitive statement of the tathāgatas.

original: de nas slob ma 'jug pa'i man ngag bshad par bya ste //
analyzed: de nas slob ma 'jug pa'i man ngag bshad par bya ste //
translated: Next, the intimate instruction for inducting the disciples should be explained.

original: phyi nas de nyid yang dag bshad //
analyzed: phyi nas de nyid yang dag bshad //
translated: Afterward, one should explain reality.

original: rnam dag ye shes gzugs can dang // 'khor ba rnam par rtog pa'i bdag / khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: rnam dag ye shes gzugs can dang // 'khor ba rnam par rtog pa'i bdag / khyad par cung zad yod ma yin // zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: There is not the slightest difference between the form of pure pristine consciousness and the self of conceptualized saṃsāra.

original: rdo rje slob dpon rig sngags 'chang gis /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon rig sngags 'chang gis /
translated: This is taught by the vajra master, the knowledge-holder.

original: gdod ma nyid nas chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu la nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: gdod ma nyid nas chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu la nye bar gnas te /
translated: From the very beginning, all phenomena abide like a dream and like the moon in water.

original: slob ma dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang / las rgyas pa thams cad bya ba'i skad @72a * //
analyzed: slob ma dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang / las rgyas pa thams cad bya ba'i skad @72a * //
translated: The disciples are admitted into the mandala, and all the extensive rites are performed.

original: cig de la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cig de la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not at that moment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad gzod ma nyid nas ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad gzod ma nyid nas ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are primordially empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de ste gang la 'du shes 'di dag gis dben pa'i skye bo las 'di dag la 'jug cing slob ma sdud pa dag ni /
analyzed: de ste gang la 'du shes 'di dag gis dben pa'i skye bo las 'di dag la 'jug cing slob ma sdud pa dag ni /
translated: If those who are devoid of these discriminations engage in these activities and gather disciples,

original: glang po che smyon pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: glang po che smyon pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: they are like a mad elephant.

original: rang gi sde brlag par byas nas pha rol gyi sde phung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sde brlag par byas nas pha rol gyi sde phung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Having destroyed their own group, they will destroy the other group.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i tshig gi don gyi khyad par kyis  rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang bya ba'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i sngags 'chang rnams kyi khyad par gyi chos kyang 'dir bstan la /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i tshig gi don gyi khyad par kyis  rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang bya ba'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i sngags 'chang rnams kyi khyad par gyi chos kyang 'dir bstan la /
translated: Thus, the distinctive meaning of the words expressed also teaches here the distinctive qualities of mantra practitioners who engage in Yoga Tantra and Kriya Tantra.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor chen po la khyad par du lhan cig skyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis khyad par du 'phags par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor chen po la khyad par du lhan cig skyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis khyad par du 'phags par bstan te /
translated: Here, the great yoga is taught to be superior by the special simultaneously-arisen samadhi.

original: 'di ltar gang du lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa de ltar sgra gnyis su go bar byas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang du lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa de ltar sgra gnyis su go bar byas te /
translated: Thus, the two words “simultaneously-arisen” are understood as follows.

original: gang zhes dang por byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba'i skad cig la bstan pa dang / gang dang dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba'i skad cig spangs te lhan cig skyes pa chen por gang gnas par 'di ni rig sngags 'chang gi slob dpon chen po yin no //
analyzed: gang zhes dang por byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba'i skad cig la bstan pa dang / gang dang dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba'i skad cig spangs te lhan cig skyes pa chen por gang gnas par 'di ni rig sngags 'chang gi slob dpon chen po yin no //
translated: In order to be understood first by the childish, it is taught in the moment of the bliss of the two organs, and in order to be understood by the yogis, it is taught in the moment of the bliss of the two organs to be abandoned, and that which abides in the great simultaneously-arisen is the great master of the knowledge-holders.

original: de la dgongs nas /
analyzed: de la dgongs nas /
translated: With that in mind,

original: mchog dgar sgom pa med cing sgom pa po yang med //🔽lus kyang med cing gzung ba med dang 'dzin pa po yang med //
analyzed: mchog dgar sgom pa med cing sgom pa po yang med // lus kyang med cing gzung ba med dang 'dzin pa po yang med //
translated: it is said, “There is no meditation in supreme joy, nor is there a meditator.🔽There is no body, no object, and no subject.

original: sha dang khrag kyang med cing bshad ba dang ni gci ba med //
analyzed: sha dang khrag kyang med cing bshad ba dang ni gci ba med //
translated: There is no flesh and blood, nor feces and urine.”

original: skyug bro rmongs med gtsang sbra mchod phyir thogs med dang // chags med sdang ba med dang rmongs med phrag dog med //
analyzed: skyug bro rmongs med gtsang sbra mchod phyir thogs med dang // chags med sdang ba med dang rmongs med phrag dog med //
translated: Disgusting, non-deluded, pure, for the sake of worship, without a topknot, without attachment, without aversion, without delusion, without envy,

original: ser sna med cing nga rgyal med la mthong bya med //
analyzed: ser sna med cing nga rgyal med la mthong bya med //
translated: without miserliness, without pride, without something to be seen,

original: bsgom dang sgom pa po med bshes dang dgra med cing //
analyzed: bsgom dang sgom pa po med bshes dang dgra med cing //
translated: without meditation, without a meditator, without a friend, without an enemy,

original: rlom sems med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa sna tshogs nyid //
analyzed: rlom sems med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa sna tshogs nyid //
translated: without conceit, the various connate [genders] themselves.

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i don gyi khyad par bstan pa'i tshig 'dis ni 'di skad ston to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i don gyi khyad par bstan pa'i tshig 'dis ni 'di skad ston to //
translated: This verse that teaches the special meaning of the Great Yoga shows the following:

original: mchog la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin rdo rje nor bur son pa'i khu ba'i bde ba 'ba' zhig lhan cig skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mchog la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin rdo rje nor bur son pa'i khu ba'i bde ba 'ba' zhig lhan cig skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: The connate is not just the bliss of the seminal essence that reaches the vajra jewel, which has the characteristics of the supreme and so forth.

original: gang yang de ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yang de ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin la /
translated: That is taught for the sake of being understood by childish beings.

original: rig sngags 'chang gi gnas ni gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa la lus la sogs pa'i 'du shes gzung bar bya ba dang 'dzin par byed pa las log pa dang / de bzhin du gang du rdzas kyi rdo rje la sogs pas phug cing dral na yang sha dang khrag gi gnod pas @72b mi brdzi ba dang /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gi gnas ni gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa la lus la sogs pa'i 'du shes gzung bar bya ba dang 'dzin par byed pa las log pa dang / de bzhin du gang du rdzas kyi rdo rje la sogs pas phug cing dral na yang sha dang khrag gi gnod pas @72b mi brdzi ba dang /
translated: The abode of a knowledge-mantra bearer is when the yogi/nī reverses the conception of body, etc. as something to be grasped and a grasper, and likewise, when even if pierced and split by a material vajra, etc. he/she is not overwhelmed by the harm of flesh and blood.

original: gang la bshad pa dang gci ba 'byung ba med pa dang / gang la skyugs pa dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / dar snabs dang / bad kan med de mi 'byung ba dang / gang la'ang mi thogs par 'gro zhing brjod pa dang /
analyzed: gang la bshad pa dang gci ba 'byung ba med pa dang / gang la skyugs pa dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / dar snabs dang / bad kan med de mi 'byung ba dang / gang la'ang mi thogs par 'gro zhing brjod pa dang /
translated: It is where feces and urine do not occur, where vomit, grease, lymph, mucus, and phlegm do not exist and do not occur, and where one goes and speaks without impediment.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi rgyal ba drug tu rtog pa gang la yang mi 'jug pa de nyid rig sngags 'chang gi khyad par yin par nges pa'i don du bstan to //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi rgyal ba drug tu rtog pa gang la yang mi 'jug pa de nyid rig sngags 'chang gi khyad par yin par nges pa'i don du bstan to //
translated: It is where one does not engage in any conception of the six migrations, such as those of desire, etc. That is taught to be the definitive meaning of the special abode of a knowledge-mantra bearer.

original: gang de nyid rlom sems thams cad dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes par yang bstan to //
analyzed: gang de nyid rlom sems thams cad dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes par yang bstan to //
translated: That very [nature] is also taught to be co-emergent, free from all conceptualization.

original: gzhan yang sngags 'chang gis slob ma mchog rnams kyi rna ba'i bug par yang 'di nyid blugs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang sngags 'chang gis slob ma mchog rnams kyi rna ba'i bug par yang 'di nyid blugs so //
translated: Moreover, this very [nature] is poured into the ear canals of the best of disciples by the mantra-holder.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature that abides by its very essence.

original: gang ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i chos ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i chos ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang /
translated: That which is a phenomenon that abides by its very essence is not even engaged in by the Tathāgatas

original: bcos shing bsgyur bar yang mi spyod pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcos shing bsgyur bar yang mi spyod pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: to be fabricated or transformed. That is why [it is so].

original: rdo rje snying pos 'di skad gsol //🔽gzod nas rang bzhin med pa yi //
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos 'di skad gsol // gzod nas rang bzhin med pa yi //
translated: Vajragarbha said this:🔽The nature of the body, pure by nature,

original: lus kyi rang bzhin dag pa la //
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin dag pa la //
translated: is primordially without inherent existence.

original: ci slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags //
analyzed: ci slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags //
translated: Why is it the nature of the elements?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is saying:

original: 'di ltar phung po dang / khams la sogs pa gzod ma nas rang bzhin gyis dag pa lags na ci'i slad du 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lha dang / las dang las kyi dbang po'i bya bar brtag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po dang / khams la sogs pa gzod ma nas rang bzhin gyis dag pa lags na ci'i slad du 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lha dang / las dang las kyi dbang po'i bya bar brtag ste /
translated: If the aggregates, elements, and so forth are primordially pure by nature, why do you imagine them to be the elements, the deities of the elements, and the actions of the faculties and karma?

original: 'di ni chos nyid kyi tshul dang mi mthun zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid kyi tshul dang mi mthun zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “inconsistent with the way of reality.”

original: de bzhin du rnam par 'phrul pa byin gyis brlab pa'i rgyud ces bya ba las kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par 'phrul pa byin gyis brlab pa'i rgyud ces bya ba las kyang ji skad du /
translated: Similarly, the Tantra Bestowing the Blessing of Emanation also says:

original: sangs rgyas mtshan ma mi mnga' zhing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mtshan ma mi mnga' zhing //
translated: The Buddha is not characterized,

original: chos kyi sku la rnam par bzhugs //🔽mtshan med 'dus ma byas pa yi //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la rnam par bzhugs // mtshan med 'dus ma byas pa yi //
translated: Dwelling in the dharmakāya,🔽He teaches the Dharma

original: mtshungs pa mi mnga' chos gsungs na //
analyzed: mtshungs pa mi mnga' chos gsungs na //
translated: That is without characteristics and unconditioned.

original: dpa' bo chen po ci slad du //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po ci slad du //
translated: Great hero, why is it

original: mtshan mar bcas pa'i cho ga 'di //
analyzed: mtshan mar bcas pa'i cho ga 'di //
translated: That you teach this ritual with characteristics

original: gsang sngags spyod pa ston par mdzad //
analyzed: gsang sngags spyod pa ston par mdzad //
translated: For those who practice secret mantra?

original: 'di ni chos nyid tshul ma lags //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid tshul ma lags //
translated: This is not the way of reality.

original: de skad gsol nas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: de skad gsol nas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Having made this request, the Bhagavān

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po yis //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po yis //
translated: Vairocana

original: de tshe lag na rdo rje la //
analyzed: de tshe lag na rdo rje la //
translated: At that time, to Vajrapāṇi,

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid 'di nyon gsungs //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid 'di nyon gsungs //
translated: he said, “Listen to the characteristics of phenomena.”

original: chos 'di rtog dang bral ba ste //
analyzed: chos 'di rtog dang bral ba ste //
translated: This phenomenon is free from conceptualization;

original: kun rtog thams cad spangs pa yin //
analyzed: kun rtog thams cad spangs pa yin //
translated: it is free from all conceptualization.

original: de la sems dang sems byung gi //
analyzed: de la sems dang sems byung gi //
translated: There, the conceptualization of mind and mental factors

original: rtog par rab tu spang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rtog par rab tu spang bar 'gyur //
translated: is completely abandoned.

original: nga yis chos sngon sangs rgyas pa //
analyzed: nga yis chos sngon sangs rgyas pa //
translated: The phenomena I previously awakened to

original: de ni mkhas las byung ba ste //
analyzed: de ni mkhas las byung ba ste //
translated: occurred through the wise ones.

original: log par rtog pa'i spyod yul ba //🔽byis pa rnams @73a * //
analyzed: log par rtog pa'i spyod yul ba // byis pa rnams @73a * //
translated: The domain of mistaken conceptualization

original: kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: kyis mi shes so //
translated: is not known by the childish.

original: yul dus mtshan ma la sogs pa //
analyzed: yul dus mtshan ma la sogs pa //
translated: They assert objects, time, signs, and so on,

original: mun gyis bsgribs pa rnams 'dod do //
analyzed: mun gyis bsgribs pa rnams 'dod do //
translated: which are obscured by darkness.

original: de dag gzung bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag gzung bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to apprehend those,

original: cho ga 'di yang brjod pa yin //
analyzed: cho ga 'di yang brjod pa yin //
translated: this ritual is also described.

original: yul med dus kyang med pa ste //
analyzed: yul med dus kyang med pa ste //
translated: There are no objects and no time;

original: bya ba med cing byed pa yang //
analyzed: bya ba med cing byed pa yang //
translated: there is no action and no agent.

original: chos rnams kun la yod med de ;
analyzed: chos rnams kun la yod med de ;
translated: All phenomena are nonexistent;

original: / chos rnams nyi tshe 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: / chos rnams nyi tshe 'ba' zhig go //
translated: phenomena are only momentary.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di ltar tshul ma lags zhes pa yan chad zhu ba'i lung yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul ma lags zhes pa yan chad zhu ba'i lung yin la /
translated: From “In this way, it is not proper” up to this point is the request.

original: de skad gsol nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni lan gyi lung du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de skad gsol nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni lan gyi lung du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Having said that, etc.

original: de nas bcom ldan rdo rje can //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan rdo rje can //
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder,

original: mkha' 'gro bde ba ster bas gsungs //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro bde ba ster bas gsungs //
translated: spoke to the dakini who bestows bliss:

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje snying po la lan gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje snying po la lan gsungs pa'o //
translated: O Vajra Essence, listen!🔽The nature of non-imagination

original: rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin dag / thams cad lus la rnam par gnas //
analyzed: rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin dag / thams cad lus la rnam par gnas //
translated: abides in all bodies.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di ltar kye rdo rje snying po gang byis pa rnams la ngas khu ba'i gzugs dang de'i lam dang rlung dang de'i lam dag spros te bstan pa de nyid kho na rig sngags 'chang gi slob dpon mkhas pa rnams la gzod ma nas rnam
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di ltar kye rdo rje snying po gang byis pa rnams la ngas khu ba'i gzugs dang de'i lam dang rlung dang de'i lam dag spros te bstan pa de nyid kho na rig sngags 'chang gi slob dpon mkhas pa rnams la gzod ma nas rnam
translated: Thus, O Vajra Essence, what I have taught to the childish in the form of semen, its path, and the winds and their paths, that very thing abides from the beginning

original: par dag pa kho nas gnas la /
analyzed: par dag pa kho nas gnas la /
translated: as pure for the wise masters of awareness mantras.

original: 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams mtshan ma'i 'du shes kho nas bcings te gnas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams mtshan ma'i 'du shes kho nas bcings te gnas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: However, the childish ordinary beings abide bound by the mere conception of signs. This is the meaning.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du 'byung ba chen po'i phung po lags zhes bya ba ni gong du brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du 'byung ba chen po'i phung po lags zhes bya ba ni gong du brjod pa nyid de /
translated: The meaning of why are they called the great elements? is as above.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad gzod ma nas dag bzhin pa las gsang sngags spyod pa rnams las 'byung ba chen por bstan pa'i dgos pa ci lags zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad gzod ma nas dag bzhin pa las gsang sngags spyod pa rnams las 'byung ba chen por bstan pa'i dgos pa ci lags zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of why is the great elements taught from the practice of secret mantra, O Bhagavān? is the meaning of the question.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: bo la ka kko la sbyor las //
analyzed: bo la ka kko la sbyor las //
translated: From the union of bola and kakkola,

original: reg pa'i sra ba chos kyi ni //
analyzed: reg pa'i sra ba chos kyi ni //
translated: the hardness of contact is the dharma of

original: sa ni de las 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sa ni de las 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: earth, which arises from that.

original: byang chub sems ni khu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni khu ba'i phyir //
translated: Because bodhicitta is the semen,

original: chu yi khams ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chu yi khams ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: the water element arises.

original: bskyod pa las ni drod skye ste //
analyzed: bskyod pa las ni drod skye ste //
translated: From movement, heat arises,

original: g-yo phyir rlung du rab tu grags //
analyzed: g-yo phyir rlung du rab tu grags //
translated: and because of movement, it is well known as wind.

original: bde ba'i phyir na nam mkha'i khams //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir na nam mkha'i khams //
translated: Because of bliss, the space element

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is taught.

original: kye rdo rje snying po chos thams cad de ltar gzod ma nas dag pa yin gyis kyang 'on kyang /
analyzed: kye rdo rje snying po chos thams cad de ltar gzod ma nas dag pa yin gyis kyang 'on kyang /
translated: O Vajra Essence, all phenomena are like that, primordially pure.

original: kun rdzob kyi dngos por rgyud dang 'bras bur mi slu ba'i chos su gnas te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi dngos por rgyud dang 'bras bur mi slu ba'i chos su gnas te /
translated: It abides as the nature of the relative, as the undeceiving result of the cause.

original: byis pa'i skye bo rnams gang du gzud par bstan pa de gnyis sprad pa na /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams gang du gzud par bstan pa de gnyis sprad pa na /
translated: When those two are joined,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: lus dang lus su phrad pa la sogs pa na mkhrang bar gnas pa sa dang sa las chu skye ste /
analyzed: lus dang lus su phrad pa la sogs pa na mkhrang bar gnas pa sa dang sa las chu skye ste /
translated: When the body and the body meet, and so on, earth abides as solidity, and water arises from earth.

original: @73b 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems de nyid chu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @73b 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems de nyid chu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that bodhicitta itself is water.

original: bskyod cing g-yos pa las dro ba 'byung ba'i phyir me'o //
analyzed: bskyod cing g-yos pa las dro ba 'byung ba'i phyir me'o //
translated: Fire arises from the movement and vibration, and therefore it is fire.

original: me dang khu ba g-yo ba'i phyir rlung ngo //
analyzed: me dang khu ba g-yo ba'i phyir rlung ngo //
translated: Wind is the movement of fire and semen.

original: gang du rtog pas dben pa'i bde ba skye ba de'i phyir nam mkha'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang du rtog pas dben pa'i bde ba skye ba de'i phyir nam mkha'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Space is where the bliss free from conceptuality arises.

original: lnga po rnams su rab tu gnas //
analyzed: lnga po rnams su rab tu gnas //
translated: The five elements are present.

original: zhes pa ni sprod pa la sogs pa'i dus su de ltar 'byung ba lnga'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba chen po yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sprod pa la sogs pa'i dus su de ltar 'byung ba lnga'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba chen po yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “great element” because the five elements arise in that way at the time of union and so on.

original: gang phyir 'byung ba che bde ba //
analyzed: gang phyir 'byung ba che bde ba //
translated: Because the great elements are produced by effort,

original: de phyir bde ba de nyid min //
analyzed: de phyir bde ba de nyid min //
translated: therefore that pleasure is not the real one.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rtsol ba'i shugs kyis 'byung ba chen po lnga rim par 'byung la de'i dbang gis bde ba de'i phyir 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob ste yang dag pa'i lhan cig skyes pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rtsol ba'i shugs kyis 'byung ba chen po lnga rim par 'byung la de'i dbang gis bde ba de'i phyir 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob ste yang dag pa'i lhan cig skyes pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, by the force of effort, the five great elements are produced in sequence, and by their power, that pleasure is produced. Therefore, this is the worldly relative, not the real innate.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: lhan cig skyes pas gang skyes pa //🔽lhan cig skyes par de brjod bya //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pas gang skyes pa // lhan cig skyes par de brjod bya //
translated: Whatever is produced by the innate🔽is said to be innate.

original: rang bzhin lhan cig skyes zhes brjod //
analyzed: rang bzhin lhan cig skyes zhes brjod //
translated: The nature is said to be innate.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus,

original: 'di ltar bya ba dang spyod pa kun las 'das pa dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can kho na lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba dang spyod pa kun las 'das pa dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can kho na lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: transcending all activities and conduct, and abiding in the nature, which has the characteristic of space, is the innate.

original: dka' thub dka' spyod kun las 'das shing rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dka' thub dka' spyod kun las 'das shing rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because it transcends all austerities and hardships and abides in the nature, that is the meaning.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang ji skad du /
translated: Also, in the Root Tantra, it says:

original: ngo bo nyid du gang gnas pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du gang gnas pa //
translated: That which abides in its own nature

original: de nyid lhan cig skyes pa ste ;
analyzed: de nyid lhan cig skyes pa ste ;
translated: is just co-emergent,

original: / yi ge las 'das mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: / yi ge las 'das mtshan nyid can //
translated: having the characteristic of being beyond syllables,

original: ngag gis brjod pa'i lam las 'das //
analyzed: ngag gis brjod pa'i lam las 'das //
translated: beyond the path of verbal expression.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rnam pa thams cad sdom gcig pa //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad sdom gcig pa //
translated: The single seal of all aspects,

original: phyag rgya byed pa spang pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phyag rgya byed pa spang pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to abandon the activity of seals,

original: rnal 'byor snying rje thabs su 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor snying rje thabs su 'gyur //
translated: is the method of compassion for the yogi.

original: stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa //🔽byang chub sems zhes brjod par bya ;
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa // byang chub sems zhes brjod par bya ;
translated: Emptiness and compassion are inseparable,

original: / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la /
translated: and should be called the thought of awakening.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sdom pa'i bdag nyid gcig pa dang / las dang ye shes kyi rgyu'i byed pa dang bral ba dang / rnal 'byor ba la snying rje ste thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub sems kyi bde ba rgyun ma chad par rgyu ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sdom pa'i bdag nyid gcig pa dang / las dang ye shes kyi rgyu'i byed pa dang bral ba dang / rnal 'byor ba la snying rje ste thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub sems kyi bde ba rgyun ma chad par rgyu ba dang /
translated: The single nature of the vows of all buddhas, free from the activity of the causes of karma and wisdom, is the uninterrupted movement of the bliss of the thought of awakening, which is the nature of compassion as the method for the yogi.

original: nor bu'i stong pa dang bral ba'i snying rje tha mi dad pa dang / dbyer med pa'i tshul zab mo gang la /
analyzed: nor bu'i stong pa dang bral ba'i snying rje tha mi dad pa dang / dbyer med pa'i tshul zab mo gang la /
translated: The profound way of the inseparability and indivisibility of the emptiness of the jewel and compassion is the thought of awakening.

original: don dam bya chub kyi sems zhes bya ba lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes chen por yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam bya chub kyi sems zhes bya ba lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes chen por yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it should be called the ultimate mind of enlightenment, and also the great innate pristine awareness.

original: ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ci mngon zhe na /
translated: What is the evidence?

original: sngags bzlas med cing dka' thub med la sreg blugs med //
analyzed: sngags bzlas med cing dka' thub med la sreg blugs med //
translated: There is no mantra recitation, no austerity, no burnt offerings,

original: dkyil 'khor pa yang yod min dkyil @74a * //🔽'khor yang ni med //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa yang yod min dkyil @74a * // 'khor yang ni med //
translated: no mandala, and no mandala site.

original: de ni sngags bzlas dka' thub dang ni sbyin sreg de //
analyzed: de ni sngags bzlas dka' thub dang ni sbyin sreg de //
translated: That is the mantra recitation, the austerity, and the burnt offerings,

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor pa yin de nyid dkyil 'khor nyid //
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor pa yin de nyid dkyil 'khor nyid //
translated: that is the mandala, and that is the mandala site.

original: mdo ru bsdus na sems ni 'dus pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: mdo ru bsdus na sems ni 'dus pa'i tshul can no //
translated: In brief, the mind is the way of the assembly.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi de kho na nyid la skad cig thams cad zad par bgrang ba'i phyir bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: gang la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi de kho na nyid la skad cig thams cad zad par bgrang ba'i phyir bzlas pa'o //
translated: In it, the reality of all the buddhas is the recitation, because all the moments are counted.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med par spang ba med pa'i tshul du spong ba'i phyir dka' thub po //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med par spang ba med pa'i tshul du spong ba'i phyir dka' thub po //
translated: It is the austerity, because the eight worldly dharmas and so forth are abandoned in the manner of non-abandonment, without being clung to.

original: tshig dang yi ge dang sems kyi rgyu ba la sogs pa bsreg pa'i phyir sbyin sreg go //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge dang sems kyi rgyu ba la sogs pa bsreg pa'i phyir sbyin sreg go //
translated: It is a fire offering because it burns the movement of words, syllables, and mind.

original: rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu ba mtha' dag gi snying po la gnas pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor pa dang dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu ba mtha' dag gi snying po la gnas pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor pa dang dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: It is a maṇḍala because it abides as the essence of all that moves and is motionless.

original: de ltar na sems nyid gcig tu bsdus te spyod pa 'di ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes bstan to //🔽kye'i rdo rje'i nges pa'i don gyi rgya cher bshad pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na sems nyid gcig tu bsdus te spyod pa 'di ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes bstan to // kye'i rdo rje'i nges pa'i don gyi rgya cher bshad pa las /
translated: Thus, this conduct that is gathered into the single mind is called “innate.”

original: dbang gi le'u rgya cher bshad pa ste bcu pa'o /
analyzed: dbang gi le'u rgya cher bshad pa ste bcu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the tenth chapter of the Great Commentary on the Hevajra Tantra,🔽called the Illumination of the Essential Meaning.

original: // / khams gsum rnam rgyal rang bzhin pa //
analyzed: // / khams gsum rnam rgyal rang bzhin pa //
translated: I bow to the one who is the nature of the conqueror of the three worlds,

original: zhal gcig phyag gnyis la btud de //
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag gnyis la btud de //
translated: who has one face and two arms,

original: lta stangs le'u'i rgyas bshad ni //
analyzed: lta stangs le'u'i rgyas bshad ni //
translated: and I will explain the chapter on the gaze

original: rdo rje snying pos bshad par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos bshad par bya //
translated: as taught by Vajragarbha.

original: rtsod pa rab tu rgyas pa'i dus 'di na 'gro ba dam pa ma yin pa mang po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rtsod pa rab tu rgyas pa'i dus 'di na 'gro ba dam pa ma yin pa mang po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: In this time of great dispute, many non-virtuous beings will appear.

original: de rnams la khro bo'i cha lugs dang sdang ba lta bus 'dul gyi gzhan du 'jug pa ma gzigs pas zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa lta bu dang / khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba lta bu dang / ha la ha la lta bu dang / rta mgrin lta bu dang /🔽gshin rje'i gshed po lta bur sprul par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams la khro bo'i cha lugs dang sdang ba lta bus 'dul gyi gzhan du 'jug pa ma gzigs pas zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa lta bu dang / khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba lta bu dang / ha la ha la lta bu dang / rta mgrin lta bu dang / gshin rje'i gshed po lta bur sprul par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: They are emanated as the conquerors of the three realms, Halaha, Hayagriva, and so on.

original: de'i phyir lta stangs la sogs pa'i khyad par dang / dbugs kyi khyad par dang / 'dug stangs dang / phreng ba dang / me thab dang / bsreg rdzas dang / nam phyed la sogs pa'i dus kyi khyad par gsungs la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lta stangs la sogs pa'i khyad par dang / dbugs kyi khyad par dang / 'dug stangs dang / phreng ba dang / me thab dang / bsreg rdzas dang / nam phyed la sogs pa'i dus kyi khyad par gsungs la /
translated: Therefore, the special gazes and so on, the special winds, the postures, the rosaries, the fire altars, the burnt offerings, the special times of midnight, and so on, are explained.

original: de las kyang 'dir ni lta stangs dang / rlung gi khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: de las kyang 'dir ni lta stangs dang / rlung gi khyad par bstan te /
translated: From among those, here the special gazes and the winds are explained.

original: dus dang me thab la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams ni sbyin sreg gi skabs dang / rgyud rgyas pa gzhan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dus dang me thab la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams ni sbyin sreg gi skabs dang / rgyud rgyas pa gzhan du shes par bya'o //
translated: The special times, the fire altars, and so on, should be understood from the section on fire sacrifice and other extensive tantras.

original: mnyam par ma rungs dpral ba can //
analyzed: mnyam par ma rungs dpral ba can //
translated: The equal, the fierce, and the forehead.

original: rtag tu ltung bar byed par brjod //
analyzed: rtag tu ltung bar byed par brjod //
translated: It is said to always cause downfall.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dir rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dir rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Here, dependent origination is the characteristic of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang rgyud de dang der gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang rgyud de dang der gsungs so //
translated: It has been taught by the Tathāgatas in this and that tantra.

original: de bas na gdug pa gang zhig 'dul ba'i @74b sbyor ba la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas mi bskyod pa lta bu'i sku mdog tu rang nyid lhag pa'i ltar bsgyur la /
analyzed: de bas na gdug pa gang zhig 'dul ba'i @74b sbyor ba la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas mi bskyod pa lta bu'i sku mdog tu rang nyid lhag pa'i ltar bsgyur la /
translated: Therefore, a yogin who is diligent in the application of subduing any evildoers should transform himself into the form of Akṣobhya.

original: mig gnyis dus gcig tu dpral ba'i phyogs su blta bzhin du bsgom pa dang bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg byas pas ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig gnyis dus gcig tu dpral ba'i phyogs su blta bzhin du bsgom pa dang bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg byas pas ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Meditating, reciting, and performing homa with both eyes looking simultaneously in the direction of the forehead, he will cause downfall.

original: steng na zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi sku bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: steng na zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi sku bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the form of the family of hatred resides above.

original: dbang gi lta stangs g-yon gnas //
analyzed: dbang gi lta stangs g-yon gnas //
translated: The gaze of power is on the left.

original: g-yon pa na ni gzugs brnyan gnyis //
analyzed: g-yon pa na ni gzugs brnyan gnyis //
translated: Two images are on the left.

original: zhes bya ba la sbyor ba gang zhig gis 'jig rten gsum po dbang du byed pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas /🔽rang nyid pad+ma r'a ga lta bur bsgyur la mig gnyis dus mnyam du g-yon gyi phyogs su blta bzhin du bsgom pa la sogs pa byas pas 'gro ba dbang du 'gyur te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sbyor ba gang zhig gis 'jig rten gsum po dbang du byed pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas / rang nyid pad+ma r'a ga lta bur bsgyur la mig gnyis dus mnyam du g-yon gyi phyogs su blta bzhin du bsgom pa la sogs pa byas pas 'gro ba dbang du 'gyur te //
translated: By this yoga, the yogi/nī who is intent on bringing the three worlds under control🔽should transform himself/herself into the form of a ruby, and meditate on the two eyes looking to the left side simultaneously.

original: g-yon gyi phyogs na pad+ma r'a ga lta bu'i sku bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yon gyi phyogs na pad+ma r'a ga lta bu'i sku bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By this, the world is brought under control, because the form of a ruby is located on the left side.

original: g-yas pa'i cha la dgug pa nyid //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i cha la dgug pa nyid //
translated: On the right side, there is summoning.

original: steng nas kyang ni gzugs brnyan gnyis //
analyzed: steng nas kyang ni gzugs brnyan gnyis //
translated: And from above, there are two reflections.

original: zhes bya ba la de bzhin du 'gro ba gsum po 'gugs pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de bzhin du 'gro ba gsum po 'gugs pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
translated: In this way, the yogi/nī who is intent on summoning the three worlds🔽should transform himself/herself into the form of the rising sun, and meditate on the two eyes looking slightly to the right side above simultaneously.

original: rang nyid nyi ma 'char ka lta bu'i skur bsgyur la mig gnyis dus mnyam du g-yas kyi steng phyogs su chung zad blta bzhin du bsgom pa la sogs pa byas pas 'gro ba gsum po 'gugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang nyid nyi ma 'char ka lta bu'i skur bsgyur la mig gnyis dus mnyam du g-yas kyi steng phyogs su chung zad blta bzhin du bsgom pa la sogs pa byas pas 'gro ba gsum po 'gugs par 'gyur te /
translated: By this, the three worlds are summoned.

original: g-yas phyogs na nyi ma 'char ka lta bu'i sku bzhugs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: g-yas phyogs na nyi ma 'char ka lta bu'i sku bzhugs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the body of the sun-like one is situated on the right side.

original: / dbus ma rengs pa'i lta stangs nyid //
analyzed: / dbus ma rengs pa'i lta stangs nyid //
translated: The central gaze is

original: sna yi rtse mo'i dbus su gnyis //
analyzed: sna yi rtse mo'i dbus su gnyis //
translated: the two in the middle of the tip of the nose.

original: zhes bya ba la de bzhin du 'jig rten gsum po rengs pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de bzhin du 'jig rten gsum po rengs pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
translated: Thus, the yogi/nī who is intent on paralyzing the three worlds

original: rang nyid gser bcom lta bu'i skur bsgyur la mig gnyis dus mnyam du sna'i rtse mo'i dbus su blta bzhin du bsgom pa la sogs pa byas pas 'jig rten gsum po rengs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang nyid gser bcom lta bu'i skur bsgyur la mig gnyis dus mnyam du sna'i rtse mo'i dbus su blta bzhin du bsgom pa la sogs pa byas pas 'jig rten gsum po rengs par 'gyur te /
translated: transforms his/her body into the color of refined gold, and meditates with both eyes simultaneously gazing at the middle of the tip of the nose. By doing so, the three worlds are paralyzed,

original: dbang chen gyi sku gser gyi mdog lta bu dbu ma na bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi sku gser gyi mdog lta bu dbu ma na bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body of the great lord, the color of gold, is situated in the central channel.

original: da ni lta stangs bzhi'i dus su bsgrub par bya ba'i rlung bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lta stangs bzhi'i dus su bsgrub par bya ba'i rlung bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the winds to be accomplished at the time of the four gazes,

original: 'byung ba nyid kyis ltung bar byed //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid kyis ltung bar byed //
translated: it is said, “The descent is by the elements themselves.”

original: ces bya ba la lta stangs de nyid kyi dus su rang gi srog 'byung ba ste rlung phyir 'byung ba bzhin du sbyor ba la brtson par bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la lta stangs de nyid kyi dus su rang gi srog 'byung ba ste rlung phyir 'byung ba bzhin du sbyor ba la brtson par bya ste /
translated: At the time of that very gaze, one should apply oneself to the union of exhaling one’s life-force, that is, the vāyu, as if exhaling.

original: rlung phyir phyung nas lus can thams cad tshe'i dus byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung phyir phyung nas lus can thams cad tshe'i dus byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Exhaling the vāyu causes all embodied beings to die.

original: rngub pa yis ni dbang du byed //
analyzed: rngub pa yis ni dbang du byed //
translated: Inhaling brings under one’s power.

original: ces bya ba ni lta stangs de nyid kyi dus su rang gi srog rlung nang du rdzub bzhin du sbyor ba la brtson par bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni lta stangs de nyid kyi dus su rang gi srog rlung nang du rdzub bzhin du sbyor ba la brtson par bya ste /
translated: At the time of that very gaze, one should apply oneself to the union of inhaling one’s life-force, that is, the vāyu, as if inhaling.

original: @75a * // srog gi rlung nang du gnas pas thams cad dbang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @75a * // srog gi rlung nang du gnas pas thams cad dbang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Inhaling the vāyu brings all under one’s power.

original: dgang ba yis ni 'gugs par byed //
analyzed: dgang ba yis ni 'gugs par byed //
translated: Filling brings them under one’s control.

original: ces bya ba la lta stangs de nyid kyi dus su rang gi srog rlung phyir ma btang bar bum pa can gyi sbyor bas nang du legs par bkang zhing bzung bas sbyor ba la brtson par bya ste ;
analyzed: ces bya ba la lta stangs de nyid kyi dus su rang gi srog rlung phyir ma btang bar bum pa can gyi sbyor bas nang du legs par bkang zhing bzung bas sbyor ba la brtson par bya ste ;
translated: At the time of that very gaze, one should apply oneself to the union of filling, that is, holding, the vāyu well inside with the vase yoga without exhaling.

original: rlung nang du gnas shing phyir 'byung ba med pas lus can kun gyi bdud rtsi'i rgyun zla ba lta bu 'gugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung nang du gnas shing phyir 'byung ba med pas lus can kun gyi bdud rtsi'i rgyun zla ba lta bu 'gugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the wind abides within and does not emerge externally, it attracts the stream of ambrosia of all embodied beings, like the moon.

original: zhi ba yis ni rengs par byed //
analyzed: zhi ba yis ni rengs par byed //
translated: By the peaceful, one paralyzes.

original: ces bya ba la lta stangs de nyid kyi dus su rang gi srog gi srog gi rlung phyi nang du spro ba dang / rngub pa ma yin pas ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag la sbyor ba la brtson par byas te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la lta stangs de nyid kyi dus su rang gi srog gi srog gi rlung phyi nang du spro ba dang / rngub pa ma yin pas ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag la sbyor ba la brtson par byas te /
translated: At the time of that very gaze, one should be diligent in the practice of equipoise, since one’s life-force wind neither expands externally nor is inhaled internally.

original: 'gro ba kun gyi srog rlung g-yon ba dang bral bas rengs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽da ni rnal 'byor gyi tshad bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rlon pa'i shing la ltung byed nyid //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun gyi srog rlung g-yon ba dang bral bas rengs par gyur pa'i phyir ro // da ni rnal 'byor gyi tshad bstan par bya ba'i phyir / rlon pa'i shing la ltung byed nyid //
translated: Since the life-force wind of all migrating beings is separated from the left, it becomes paralyzed.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the measure of yoga, it is said, “The descent of the tree branch,” and so on.

original: lta stangs bzhi po rnams bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa cho ga bzhin bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: lta stangs bzhi po rnams bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa cho ga bzhin bsgrubs nas /
translated: In order to accomplish the four gazes, one should accomplish the ritual of meditation, recitation, fire puja, and so on.

original: re zhig bems po'i rdzas kyi dngos po rnams la nyams sad pa dang / ting nge 'dzin brtan par gsungs so //
analyzed: re zhig bems po'i rdzas kyi dngos po rnams la nyams sad pa dang / ting nge 'dzin brtan par gsungs so //
translated: First, with regard to material things, which are inanimate, [the yogi] should test [his power] and stabilize his concentration.

original: de bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: rlon pa'i shing la ltung byed cing //
analyzed: rlon pa'i shing la ltung byed cing //
translated: he should kill a tree with leaves and branches,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: de las khyad par du gsod pa'i sbyor ba goms pas thog mar re zhig / shing ljon pa yal ga dang lo mar ldan pa rlon par 'dug pa gang zhig la rnal 'byor pas rlung 'byung bzhin du gsad pa'i lta bas bltas pa'i tshe skam par 'gyur ba'i
analyzed: de las khyad par du gsod pa'i sbyor ba goms pas thog mar re zhig / shing ljon pa yal ga dang lo mar ldan pa rlon par 'dug pa gang zhig la rnal 'byor pas rlung 'byung bzhin du gsad pa'i lta bas bltas pa'i tshe skam par 'gyur ba'i
translated: There, in particular, by the practice of killing, first, [the yogi] should kill a tree with leaves and branches, which is fresh, with the view of killing, as the wind is exhaled by the yogi.

original: dus de tsam na ma rungs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus de tsam na ma rungs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, when it becomes dry, the meaning is that [the yogi] should apply [his power] to the wicked.

original: dbang ni me tog rab tu grags //
analyzed: dbang ni me tog rab tu grags //
translated: The power is well known as the flower.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du lta stangs dang rlung gang dag dang ldan pas me tog gang la bltas pas skam pa de ni sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du lta stangs dang rlung gang dag dang ldan pas me tog gang la bltas pas skam pa de ni sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that with the gaze and the wind in that way, the flower to which he looks becomes dry, and he should apply [his power] to that.

original: rdo rje'i shing la 'gugs pa nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje'i shing la 'gugs pa nyid //
translated: The vajra tree is drawn in.

original: ces bya ba ni de bzhin du lta stangs dang / rlung gang dang ldan pas /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de bzhin du lta stangs dang / rlung gang dang ldan pas /
translated: This is the gaze and the wind energy in union with which

original: badzra la ta zhes pa'i shing shin tu mkhrang zhing rtsub pa la rnal 'byor pas bltas pa na /
analyzed: badzra la ta zhes pa'i shing shin tu mkhrang zhing rtsub pa la rnal 'byor pas bltas pa na /
translated: the yogin looks at the vajra tree, which is very hard and rough.

original: 'bras kyi snye ma legs par smin pa ltar dgu bar gyur pa na sbyar bar bye zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras kyi snye ma legs par smin pa ltar dgu bar gyur pa na sbyar bar bye zhes pa'i don to //
translated: When it is bent like a well-ripened rice ear, then one should apply the union.

original: g-yo bcas rtsal rengs byed nyid //🔽ces pa ni 'di ltang lta stangs dang rlung gang dag dang ldan pas sgang bu mthon po dang / ri bo la sogs pa'i rtse mo gang dag ni skyes pa'i rtsva @75b phra mo shin tu mnyen pa /
analyzed: g-yo bcas rtsal rengs byed nyid // ces pa ni 'di ltang lta stangs dang rlung gang dag dang ldan pas sgang bu mthon po dang / ri bo la sogs pa'i rtse mo gang dag ni skyes pa'i rtsva @75b phra mo shin tu mnyen pa /
translated: The moving one is the paralysis of the power.🔽This is the gaze and the wind energy in union with which🔽the yogin looks at the tips of the high mounds, mountains, and so forth, which are the nature of being greatly moved by the wind when moved by the wind,

original: rta'i rnga ma'i nyag ma tsam la rlung gis bskyod na cher g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can la rnal 'byor pas bltas pa na rlung la sogs pas mi bsgul ba na sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rta'i rnga ma'i nyag ma tsam la rlung gis bskyod na cher g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can la rnal 'byor pas bltas pa na rlung la sogs pas mi bsgul ba na sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the very soft, tender grass of the field, the size of a horsehair. When it is unmoved by the wind, then one should apply the union.

original: 'di'i des pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'di'i des pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las ji skad du /
translated: Here, “skill” is as stated in the Root Tantra:

original: srog rlung byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa rnal 'byor rang gi lus la gsod par nus pa dang / de bzhin du srog gnyis po rang la dbang du gyur pa dang / rang gi byang chub kyi sems ji lta ba bzhin du 'gugs nus pa dang /
analyzed: srog rlung byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa rnal 'byor rang gi lus la gsod par nus pa dang / de bzhin du srog gnyis po rang la dbang du gyur pa dang / rang gi byang chub kyi sems ji lta ba bzhin du 'gugs nus pa dang /
translated: The life-force wind endowed with the spirit of enlightenment is able to kill the yogi’s own body, and likewise, the two life-forces are mastered by oneself, and one is able to draw forth one’s own spirit of enlightenment just as it is.

original: de bzhin du srog gnyis po rengs par byas te mi g-yo ba na phyi nang gi bdag nyid can la 'khor lo ltar bskor gyi gzhan du 'jig rten pa'i bzhad gad du 'gyur bas mi bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog gnyis po rengs par byas te mi g-yo ba na phyi nang gi bdag nyid can la 'khor lo ltar bskor gyi gzhan du 'jig rten pa'i bzhad gad du 'gyur bas mi bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: Likewise, having immobilized the two life-forces so that they are unmoving, one should rotate them like a wheel within the nature of the outer and inner. Otherwise, one should not do this, because it would be a joke for the world.

original: da ni sbyor ba bsgrub pa'i dus bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni sbyor ba bsgrub pa'i dus bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to teach the time for accomplishing the practice, it is said:

original: zla drug goms pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: zla drug goms pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: In six months, through the practice of familiarization,

original: 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
analyzed: 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
translated: there is accomplishment, of this there is no doubt.

original: 'di la 'khrul par mi bya ste //
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul par mi bya ste //
translated: One should not err in this,

original: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul bsam mi khyab //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul bsam mi khyab //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: because the miracles of the buddhas are inconceivable.

original: zla ba drug tu rgyun mchad par gnas pas mthar 'khod de yan lag drug gis bla ma'i bka' ltar byas na 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba drug tu rgyun mchad par gnas pas mthar 'khod de yan lag drug gis bla ma'i bka' ltar byas na 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since one abides continuously for six months, one is finally seated, and if one acts in accordance with the guru's command with the six limbs, one will be successful.

original: zla ba drug ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rgyud thams cad kyi thun mong gi chos su gsungs so //
analyzed: zla ba drug ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rgyud thams cad kyi thun mong gi chos su gsungs so //
translated: This term six months is a common teaching in all tantras.

original: de lta bas na gang gis dang por rang gi lus la rnam pa bzhi po bsgrubs nas sems can gdul bar bya ba dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa yin pas 'di la 'khrul pa dang dogs pa spang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gis dang por rang gi lus la rnam pa bzhi po bsgrubs nas sems can gdul bar bya ba dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa yin pas 'di la 'khrul pa dang dogs pa spang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that whoever first accomplishes the four aspects in one's body and then tames sentient beings to be tamed is the rule of the Tathagata, so one should abandon error and doubt in this.

original: lta stangs bzhi rnams bsgrubs nas ni //
analyzed: lta stangs bzhi rnams bsgrubs nas ni //
translated: Having accomplished the four gazes,

original: mkhas pas sems can gzud par bya //
analyzed: mkhas pas sems can gzud par bya //
translated: the wise one should engage sentient beings.

original: 'di dag gsad par mi bya ste //
analyzed: 'di dag gsad par mi bya ste //
translated: One should not kill these,

original: dam tshig nges par nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: dam tshig nges par nyams par 'gyur //
translated: for it is a definite violation of the commitments.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gsad pa la sogs pa'i las gang dag gsungs pa de dag sems can gdul ba'i phyir re zhig skrag par bya ba yin la des 'jug par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gsad pa la sogs pa'i las gang dag gsungs pa de dag sems can gdul ba'i phyir re zhig skrag par bya ba yin la des 'jug par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, whatever actions such as killing are taught, they are for the sake of training sentient beings, and they are to be done for the time being in order to frighten them, and thereby they will enter the teaching.

original: gzhan du na nges par gtan du gsad na phyag rgya chen po'i dam tshig nyams te mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na nges par gtan du gsad na phyag rgya chen po'i dam tshig nyams te mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if one definitely kills forever, one will violate the pledge of the great seal and will go to Avīci Hell.

original: de bas na nges pa'i don du las rnam pa bzhi po rang gi lus la bsgrub par gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na nges pa'i don du las rnam pa bzhi po rang gi lus la bsgrub par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in the definitive meaning, the four kinds of actions are taught to be accomplished on one’s own body.

original: de yang 'di ltar /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar /
translated: And that is as follows.

original: sems can slu ba spangs nas ni //
analyzed: sems can slu ba spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned the deception of sentient beings,

original: bya ba ma yin thams cad bya //🔽sems can gnod pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin thams cad bya // sems can gnod pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: do all that is not to be done.

original: phyag rgya'i dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The spiritual attainment of the seal is not attained🔽by merely harming sentient beings.

original: @76a * // 'di ltar gsad pa la sogs pa'i las lta ci smos kyi gang la bslu bar bya ba'i thabs nye bar gzung ste gnas pa tsam gyis sems can thams cad bslus pa yang yin la /
analyzed: @76a * // 'di ltar gsad pa la sogs pa'i las lta ci smos kyi gang la bslu bar bya ba'i thabs nye bar gzung ste gnas pa tsam gyis sems can thams cad bslus pa yang yin la /
translated: Thus, what need is there to speak of actions such as killing? Even by merely holding the method of deceiving sentient beings, all sentient beings are deceived.

original: des dam tshig nyams te rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya'i grub pa las nyams par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des dam tshig nyams te rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya'i grub pa las nyams par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one's commitments are impaired, and one falls from the accomplishment of the consort who is endowed with all supreme aspects.🔽 Now, in order to teach the commitments of eating, protecting, and so on, for the adepts,

original: da ni sgrub pa po rnams la bza' ba dang bsrung ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sgrub pa po rnams la bza' ba dang bsrung ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: de ru dam tshig bza' bya ba //
analyzed: de ru dam tshig bza' bya ba //
translated: There, one should eat the commitments,🔽the first Na, Ga, and Ha,

original: na dang ga ha dang po dang // mtha' ma'i shva dang dang po'i shva //
analyzed: na dang ga ha dang po dang // mtha' ma'i shva dang dang po'i shva //
translated: and the first and last Sva,

original: kye yi rdo rje'i dngos grub phyir //
analyzed: kye yi rdo rje'i dngos grub phyir //
translated: for the sake of the spiritual power of Hevajra.

original: bdud rtsi lnga yang de bzhin bza' //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga yang de bzhin bza' //
translated: One should also eat the five nectars.

original: zhes bya ba la kye'i rdo rje'i dam tshig la gnas pa rnams kyis phyi nang gi bye brag gis phye la bza' ba dang bsrung ba bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la kye'i rdo rje'i dam tshig la gnas pa rnams kyis phyi nang gi bye brag gis phye la bza' ba dang bsrung ba bya'o //
translated: Those who abide in the commitments of Hevajra should eat and protect, divided by the distinctions of outer and inner.

original: de la skyes bu'i ming gi dang po'i yi ge na'o //🔽gang gi ba lang gi ming gi dang po'i yi ge ga'o //
analyzed: de la skyes bu'i ming gi dang po'i yi ge na'o // gang gi ba lang gi ming gi dang po'i yi ge ga'o //
translated: There, the first letter of a person's name is Na.🔽The first letter of a cow's name is Ga.

original: ha ni glang po che'i ming gi dang po'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: ha ni glang po che'i ming gi dang po'i yi ge'o //
translated: Ha is the first letter of an elephant's name.

original: shva ni rta'i mtha' ma'i ming gi yi ge'o ;
analyzed: shva ni rta'i mtha' ma'i ming gi yi ge'o ;
translated: Śva is the last letter of the name of the horse.

original: / de bzhin du shva ni khyi'i ming gi dang po'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du shva ni khyi'i ming gi dang po'i yi ge'o //
translated: Similarly, śva is the first letter of the name of the dog.

original: rdzas 'di rnams mnyam par byas la mthe bo'i tshigs mdud tsam gyi ril bu byas te sbyang ba dang / spel ba dang / sbar ba dang bdud rtsir byas te zos pas phyi'i dngos grub tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: rdzas 'di rnams mnyam par byas la mthe bo'i tshigs mdud tsam gyi ril bu byas te sbyang ba dang / spel ba dang / sbar ba dang bdud rtsir byas te zos pas phyi'i dngos grub tu 'gyur la /
translated: Having mixed these substances, one should make a pill the size of a finger joint, and by purifying, increasing, burning, and making it nectar, one will attain external powers.

original: de bzhin du nang du ni mgo la sogs pa'i ming can mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yul las bzlog ste gnas par gsungs pas mchog gi grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang du ni mgo la sogs pa'i ming can mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yul las bzlog ste gnas par gsungs pas mchog gi grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, by reversing the objects such as the eyes, which are named after the head, and so on, and placing them internally, one will attain supreme powers.

original: de bzhin du bdud rtsi lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdud rtsi lnga ste /
translated: Similarly, there are five nectars:

original: bi dang / mu dang / ma dang / ra dang shu rnams kyang phyi nang gis phyi la spyad par bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' lung ngo //
analyzed: bi dang / mu dang / ma dang / ra dang shu rnams kyang phyi nang gis phyi la spyad par bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' lung ngo //
translated: vi, mu, ma, ra, and śu. These are also external and internal, and are to be used externally. This is the word of the Tathāgata.

original: kye rdor las gsungs mtshan nyid ldan //
analyzed: kye rdor las gsungs mtshan nyid ldan //
translated: Endowed with the characteristics taught in the Hevajra Tantra,

original: skye ba bdun pa de nas mtshon //
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa de nas mtshon //
translated: Then, the one with seven births, the weapon,

original: khyad par dga' ba la smod pa //
analyzed: khyad par dga' ba la smod pa //
translated: Despising special joy,🔽

original: lan bdun pa ni 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: lan bdun pa ni 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: The seventh is accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba'i drang ba dang nges pa rnams mngon du bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i drang ba dang nges pa rnams mngon du bstan pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the provisional and definitive meanings are clearly taught.

original: 'on kyang ji lta ba'i skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid ma bstan pa gsal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji lta ba'i skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid ma bstan pa gsal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: However, in order to clearly teach the characteristics of the seven types of birth, it is said:🔽Beautiful voice, beautiful eyes,

original: skad snyan mig ni sdug pa dang // lus la dri ldan gzi brjid che //
analyzed: skad snyan mig ni sdug pa dang // lus la dri ldan gzi brjid che //
translated: smelling body, great splendor,

original: de yi grib ma bdun du 'gyur //🔽mthong nas rnal 'byor pa yis mtshon //
analyzed: de yi grib ma bdun du 'gyur // mthong nas rnal 'byor pa yis mtshon //
translated: and seven shadows.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Having seen, the yogi should recognize.🔽Whoever has a beautiful voice,🔽long eyes with white and black clearly divided, a body that smells like musk,

original: gang zhig mi mo la la dag / skad kyi nga ro mdzes pa dang // mig dkyus ring la dkar nag 'byes pa dang / lus la gla @76b rtsi lta bu dang / ga bur lta bu'i dri dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du gzi brjid che ba dang /
analyzed: gang zhig mi mo la la dag / skad kyi nga ro mdzes pa dang // mig dkyus ring la dkar nag 'byes pa dang / lus la gla @76b rtsi lta bu dang / ga bur lta bu'i dri dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du gzi brjid che ba dang /
translated: and the scent of camphor, and likewise, great splendor,

original: grib ma bdun gyur gang la yod pa de ni skye ba bdun par mtshon cing rtogs par byas la /
analyzed: grib ma bdun gyur gang la yod pa de ni skye ba bdun par mtshon cing rtogs par byas la /
translated: and whoever has seven shadows, that person is recognized as having seven births.

original: de lta bu rnyed nas rnal 'byor pas rgya shug gi tshi gu tsam gyi ril bu byas te zos pas mkha' la spyod par 'gyur zhing bskal pa dpag tu med par 'tshol de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa'i lus kyis ni /
